translation:
n. 标签; 称标记，符号; [建] 门或窗户上面的线脚
vt. 贴标签于; 把…称为; 把…列为; [化]用放射性元素使（元素或原子等）示踪

时态：labelled, labelling, labels
分布：标签(83%)，标记(7%)，唱片公司(3%)，称号(3%)，贴标签于(3%)，把 ... 归类(1%)


→来自leb,撕开，词源同lap,lapel,进一步来自skel,砍，撕，词源同shell, scissor.原义为撕开的小布条，后用于指用布条标签。拼写演变比较locus,ring.
n.标签v.把...称为;用标签于;用标签标明The rebels labeled the labor laboring in the laboratory and lavatory.反叛者给在实验室和舆洗室劳动的劳工贴上标签.



noun countable SIGN  符号   ADVANCED  ■a piece of paper or other material which gives you information about the object it is fixed to 标签，标牌
•Remember to put some address labels on the suitcases.别忘了把地址标签贴在行李箱上。

•Washing instructions should be on the label.标签上应该注明洗涤注意事项。
 ADVANCED  ■a word or a phrase which is used to describe the characteristics or qualities of people, activities or things, often in a way that is unfair （用来描述人、活动或事物特点或特性的，常为不公正的）称号，绰号
•He seems to be stuck with the label of 'troublemaker'.他好像被人贴上了“麻烦制造者”的标签。

['leɪ.bəl] noun countable COMPANY  公司   ADVANCED  ■a company which produces goods for sale, the goods themselves, or the company's name or symbol 公司；品牌商品；公司名称；公司标志
•Her favourite designer label (= maker of expensive clothes) is Armani.她最喜欢的服装品牌是亚曼尼。

•Their own-label vegetarian products have been a huge success.他们自有品牌的素食产品非常受欢迎。

•The group have just signed (= arranged to record) with a new record label.该演唱组合刚刚与一家新的唱片公司签约。

['leɪ.bəl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-) ADVANCED  ■to fasten a label to 贴标签
•[+ adj] The parcel was clearly labelled 'Fragile'.这个包裹上清楚地标著「易碎品”。

•If you spend any time in prison, you're labelled as a criminal for the rest of your life.一旦入过狱，“罪犯”的帽子就会一辈子扣在你的头上。





tag, label

这组词都有“标签”的意思，其区别是：
tag: 多指临时系上的标签。
label: 指上面标明货主姓名、地址及货物名称、重量、尺寸等内容的标签。


n. 标签；商标；签条
 - ticket, brand, logo, tag
examples: 英 ['leɪbl] 美 ['leɪbl]
n.标记；标签；称号；唱片公司vt.贴标签于；把 ... 归类

(1) Put a label on your luggage.(2) He has been given a label of "playboy" by his friends.(3) It's his first release for a major label.(4) The bottle is labeled poison.(5) Be sure to label all the test tubes .(6) His work is difficult to label accurately.
(1) 在你行李上做个标记。(2) 他的朋友给他起了一个“花花公子”的绰号。(3) 这是他在大唱片公司发行的第一张唱片。(4) 瓶上标明有毒。(5) 一定要把所有的试管都贴上标签。(6) 他的工作很难准确归类。
[sound:youdao-ae0517b9-77c67ed0-ba927d11-5e57d3a4-5979aff2.mp3]

translation:
n. 实验室; 实验课; 研究室; 药厂

分布：实验室(100%)


→来自拉丁语labor,劳作，努力，辛劳，引申词义实验室。
实验室(labor+atory地方→劳动之地→实验室)[labor=labor,表示"劳动"]
实验室(labor劳动)[-atory 1.表形容词"有…性质的"2.表名词"场所,地点"]



US ['læb.rə.tɔ:r.i] (informal lab) noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a room or building with scientific equipment for doing scientific tests or for teaching science, or a place where chemicals or medicines are produced 实验室；实验大楼
•research laboratories研究实验室

•a computer laboratory电脑实验室

•Laboratory tests suggest that the new drug may be used to treat cancer.实验室测试显示这种新药可用于治疗癌症。




n. [试验]  [临床] 实验室，研究室
 - lab
examples: 英 [lə'bɒrətri] 美 ['læbrətɔːri]
n.实验室

(1) They need one laboratory technician.(2) The school has a large biological laboratory.(3) The product is on trial in our laboratory.(4) The students will have an experiment in the laboratory tomorrow.(5) Our professor usually works in the laboratory doing his research.
(1) 他们需要一名实验室技术员。(2) 这所学校有一个很大的生物实验室。(3) 该产品正在由我们实验室做测试。(4) 学生们明天要在实验室里做实验。(5) 我们的教授常常在实验室搞研究。
[sound:youdao-5b8ac371-d851cd3f-b89efaa6-c598e269-66dc39e4.mp3]
英 ['leɪbə(r)] 美 ['leɪbər]
n.劳动；劳工；分娩v.努力；干苦力活；困难吃力地行进；反复说明Labourn.(英国)工党

(1) Labour is not only a necessity but also a pleasure.(2) It takes a lot of labour to build a railway.(3) The labour question must come to the fore next session.(4) She was in labour for three hours.(5) He was elected to the leadership of the Labour Party.(6) We labour for the happiness of mankind.(7) The editor laboured over the manuscript till early morning.(8) Miners labour in the bowels of earth.(9) The old man laboured up the hillside.(10) The horses laboured up the steep slope.(11) There is no need to labour the argument.(12) You needn't labour a point that is perfectly plain.

(1) 劳动不仅是人生所必需的，而且是一种乐趣。(2) 修筑一条铁路要花费许多劳动力。(3) 劳工问题必将成为下届会议的热门话题。(4) 她的分娩过程长达三小时。(5) 他被选为工党的领导人。(6) 我们为人类的幸福而努力。(7) 编辑煞费苦心地修改稿件，一直干到清晨。(8) 矿工们在地底下劳动。(9) 老人吃力地登上山腰。(10) 那些马费力地爬上了陡坡。(11) 该论据无需详细说明或讨论。(12) 这点很明显，你用不着讲个没完。
[sound:youdao-a7442185-50abb91e-fd92008b-6effe2ff-e3514d72.mp3]

translation:
n. 蕾丝; 透孔织品; 鞋带; 系带
vt. 给（书、讲话等）润色; 给（饮料等）掺（少量的酒、药、毒药等）; 给（鞋、靴等）穿鞋带; 使编织（或交织、缠绕）在一起
vi. 以系带系紧

时态：laced, lacing, laces
分布：花边(75%)，鞋带(10%)，饰带(6%)，缎带(3%)，系带子(3%)，饰以花边(2%)，把酒搀入(1%)


→来自拉丁语lacere,引诱，诱惑，词源同delicious,elicit.引申词义罗网，陷阱，后指编织罗网的绳索，带子，后用于指蕾丝，花边等。
n.花边;带子,鞋带v.系带,扎带The lace placed in the palace is replaced first, and displaced later.放在皇宫的带子先被替换,后来被转移.
【记】读：蕾丝（花边）



noun MATERIAL  材料  uncountable ■a decorative cloth which is made by weaving thin thread in delicate patterns with holes in them 网眼织物；花边，蕾丝
•lace curtains蕾丝窗帘

[leɪs] noun STRING  绳  countable usually plural ■a string which you use to fasten openings, especially in shoes, by putting it through two lines of small holes and tying the ends together 鞋带
•Your shoe laces are undone.你的鞋带没有系好。

[leɪs] verb transitive ADD ALCOHOL  加酒精  ■to add alcohol or drugs to food or drink, often secretly （常指偷偷地）在（食物或饮料）中掺（酒、药等）
•coffee laced with brandy加了白兰地的咖啡

[leɪs] verb transitive STRING  绳  ■to put the lace of a shoe or boot through its holes, or to fasten a shoe or boot by tying a lace 给…穿鞋带，系（鞋或靴子）的鞋带
[leɪs] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] lace sth up ■to fasten shoes, boots or a piece of clothing by tying the laces 系好…的鞋带；系好…的系带
•She can lace up her shoes and she's only five!她才五岁就能自己系鞋带！

•lace-up shoes系带鞋




n. [纺] 花边；鞋带；饰带；少量烈酒
 - tie, gymp
examples: 英 [leɪs] 美 [leɪs]
n.鞋带；饰带；花边；缎带v.系带子；饰以花边；把酒搀入；抨击

(1) He stopped to do up his shoe lace.(2) My shoe lace keeps coming undone.(3) My daughter wears a dress embellished with lace and ribbons today.(4) She wears a dress with delicate lace.(5) Jewelry and lace are mostly feminine belongings.(6) If you don't lace up your shoes, you'll trip over.(7) I always have troubles lacing these football boots.(8) The princess's coat was of red silk laced with gold thread.
(1) 他停下来把鞋带系上。(2) 我的鞋带老是松开。(3) 今天我女儿穿了一件有花边和饰带的连衣裙。(4) 她穿了一件带有精致花边的裙子。(5) 珠宝和蕾丝大多是女性用品。(6) 如果你不系好鞋带，你会被绊倒的。(7) 我给足球鞋穿鞋带时总是遇到麻烦。(8) 王妃的外衣是镶有金线的红色绸缎做的。
[sound:youdao-f6bd96d5-3a5697c0-c3525d6e-387d9ec1-c25565f4.mp3]

translation:
vt. 缺乏，缺少; 需要的东西
n. 缺乏，不足，没有; 缺少的东西

时态：lacked, lacking, lacks
分布：缺乏(77%)，不足(13%)，无(10%)


→来自leg,滴，渗透，词源同leak.引申词义短缺，缺陷，缺乏。
n./v.缺乏,不足The backward man lacks black background.落后的男子缺少黑色背景.



noun lack of sth  ESSENTIAL  ■when something is not available or when there is not enough of it 没有…，…匮乏，…短缺
•Her only problem is lack of confidence.她唯一的问题是缺乏自信。

•Lack of sleep had made him irritable.睡眠不足令他烦躁易怒。

•If he fails it won't be for/through lack of effort (= he has certainly tried).他若失败了，那肯定不是因为他努力不够。

•We won't be going on holiday this year - lack of funds, I'm afraid.今年我们恐怕不会去渡假了——因为没钱。

[læk] verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to not have or not have enough of something that is needed or wanted 缺少，缺乏
•He just lacks a little confidence.他只是有点缺乏自信。

•What we lack in this house is space to store things.我们这所房子缺少的是储物空间。

•We are lacking three members of staff due to illness.我们有三人因病缺席。

[læk] verb transitive   Common Learner Errors   lackRemember that when lack  is a verb it is never followed by 'of'.Don't say 'something lacks of something', say something lacks something :✗ Our town lacks of a good shopping centre.Our town lacks a good shopping centre.




need, require, lack, want

这组词都有“缺少、短少”的意思，其区别是：
need: 语气较重，指需要必不可少的东西，强调急需。
require: 使用广泛，语气较轻。强调急需时可与need换用，但有时暗示所需的人或物是完成某一任务必不可少的。
lack: 指完全短缺或数量不足。
want: 侧重缺少某种必需之物，或个人渴望得到的东西。



shortage, absence, scarcity, lack, want

这组词都有“缺乏，不足”的意思，其区别是：
shortage: 指不足，但侧重达不到规定的，需要的或已知应有的数量。
absence: 指某物根本不存在或完全短缺，或某人虽存在，但未到现场。
scarcity: 指产量不足或缺乏某物难以应付或满足需要。
lack: 普通用词，指部分或完全的不足。
want: 指完全或短缺某物，侧重缺少之物是必需的东西。使用范围比lack窄些。


vt. 缺乏；不足；没有；需要
 - ask, claim
vi. 缺乏；不足；没有
 - fail, low in
n. 缺乏；不足
 - shortage, short of, deficiency, need, drought
examples: 英 [læk] 美 [læk]
n.缺乏；无v.缺乏；不足

(1) Her decision seems to show a lack of political judgement.(2) Lack of sun retards plant growth.(3) In a cold winter, many wild animals can die from lack of food.(4) I tell you, people will lack the means to live.(5) He is good at his job but he seems to lack confidence.
(1) 她的决定似乎显示出缺乏政治判断力。(2) 光照不足则植物生长缓慢。(3) 在严寒的冬天,很多野生动物可能因缺乏食物而死去。(4) 我告诉你,人们将缺乏生活资料。(5) 他工作不错，但似乎缺乏信心。
[sound:youdao-82aac6b4-146600fe-7e15081c-97e55a3d-64c123c1.mp3]

translation:
n. 梯子，阶梯; 梯状物; 途径; （紧身裤袜或长筒袜的）滑丝
vi. 使（袜子）发生抽丝现象; 像长筒袜一样抽丝

时态：laddered, laddering, ladders
分布：梯子(79%)，阶梯(19%)，梯状物(2%)


→来自klei,倾斜，前倾，词源同lean,incline.后用来指梯子。
n.梯子,阶梯The lady is glad to give the salad to the sad lad on the ladder.女士乐意把色拉送给梯子上的那位悲哀的小伙子.



US [-ɚ] noun EQUIPMENT  设施   IMPROVER  countable ■a piece of equipment used for climbing up and down, which consists of two vertical bars or pieces of rope joined to each other by a set of horizontal steps 梯子
•She was up a ladder, cleaning the window.她站在梯子上擦窗子。

UK ['læd.ər] US [-ɚ] noun SERIES OF STAGES  阶段  only singular ■a series of increasingly important jobs or stages in a particular type of work or process （职位晋升的）阶梯；（发展的）阶段
•Once he started at Paramount in 1967, he moved rapidly up the corporate ladder.1967年他开始在派拉蒙电影公司工作，此后他在公司里升得很快。

•a first rung/step on the employment ladder职场的第一个台阶

UK ['læd.ər] US [-ɚ] noun HOLE  洞  countable UK (US run) ■a long vertical hole in a pair of tights or a stocking （紧身裤袜或长筒袜的）抽丝，滑丝
UK ['læd.ər] US [-ɚ] noun COMPETITION  比赛  countable (also ladder tournament) mainly UK ■(in particular sports) a system in which all the players who play regularly are given a position in a list and can improve their position by beating other players in that list （某项体育比赛采用的）阶梯晋级赛
•a squash ladder壁球阶梯晋级赛

UK ['læd.ər] US [-ɚ] verb intransitive or transitive UK ■If a pair of tights or stockings ladder or if you ladder them, a long hole appears in them （紧身衣、袜子）抽丝；被刮破
•Damn! That's the second pair of tights I've laddered today!真该死！我今天换上的第二条紧身裤也抽丝了。




n. 阶梯；途径；梯状物
 - mechanism, approach, pass
vi. 成名；发迹
 - raise oneself, make his mark
examples: 英 ['lædə(r)] 美 ['lædər]
n.阶梯；梯子；梯状物
(1) Diligence is often a ladder to success.(2) He was halfway down the ladder when he fell.(3) This ladder isn't very stable.(4) It's considered unlucky to walk under a ladder.
(1) 勤勉常常是通往成功的阶梯。(2) 他下阶梯时，半路摔倒了。(3) 这架梯子不太牢靠。(4) 从梯子下面走过被认为是不吉利的。
[sound:youdao-9bffb18d-d9ce5521-1c88e70c-73d2452e-091c2b22.mp3]

translation:
n. （指成年女子，有些人尤其是长者认为这样说比较礼貌）女士; （不尊重的非正式称呼）女人; （在英国对女贵族或贵族成员的妻子女儿或爵士妻子的称呼）夫人; 举止文雅且有教养的女子

分布：女士(78%)，夫人(22%)


→来自古英语hlaefdige,准备面包的人，女主人，hlaef,面包，词源同loaf,-dige,揉捏，词源同dough,dairy.后用于尊称夫人，女士。比较lord.
n.女士,夫人The lady is glad to give the salad to the sad lad on the ladder.女士乐意把色拉送给梯子上的那位悲哀的小伙子.



noun  ESSENTIAL  countable ■a polite or old fashioned way of referring to or talking to a woman 女士
•There's a young lady here to see you.这里有位年轻的女士要见你。

•Mind your language - there are ladies present!你说话注意点——有女士在场！

•Say "thank you" to the lady, children.孩子们，对这位女士说“谢谢。”

•old-fashioned Is the lady of the house (= the most important or only woman who lives in the house) at home?女主人在家吗？
countable old-fashioned ■a woman who behaves in a way that is traditionally considered to be suitable for a woman 淑女
•Of course I remember Mrs Connor - she was a real lady.我当然记得康纳太太—— 她是个真正的淑女。
countable old-fashioned ■sometimes used before the name of a job done by a woman （用于女性的职业名字前）
•a lady doctor女医生
[as form of address] US ■used to talk to a woman in a way that is not polite and is considered offensive by many women （用作不礼貌的称呼）女士，女人
•Hey, lady, what's the rush?嘿，女士，忙甚么呢？
ladies UK (US ladies' room) only singular [+ sing/pl verb] ■a women's toilet in a public place or building such as a hotel or restaurant 女洗手间，女厕所
•I'm just going to the ladies.我正要去女洗手间。

•Is there a ladies on this floor?这层楼上有女厕所吗？
ladies and gentlemen ■used to talk to the members of the audience when you are making a speech （讲话时对听众的称呼）女士们先生们
•Good evening, ladies and gentlemen, and welcome to the Theatre Royal.女士们先生们，晚上好，欢迎大家来到皇家剧院。





female, woman, lady

这组词都有“女性”的意思，其区别是：
female: 与male“男(性)的，公的，雄的”相对，强调性别，可指人或动物，但除用于科学和统计上外，大多含贬义。
woman: 与man相对，侧重成年妇女的特点，系成年妇女的通称。
lady: 与gentleman相对，强调所谓高贵的气质、品德和教养等。也指对女性的礼貌称呼。



madam, lady, mrs, miss

这些名词均表示对女性的尊称。
madam: 夫人、太太，女士，小姐。与尊称男人的用词sir相对，多用于对已婚或未婚妇女的礼貌称呼，如店员对女顾客的称呼，后面不加姓名。如果已知对方的身份或姓名可在此词后面加上姓名职位。
lady: 女士，夫人，与gentleman相对，是对女性的礼貌称呼，多用于演讲或祝酒时称呼在场的女性。
mrs: 太太，夫人，是mistress的缩略形式，对已婚妇女的称呼。
miss: 小姐，是对未婚或不知婚姻状况的女性的称呼，与姓氏连用时应大写。


n. 女士，夫人；小姐；妻子
 - Miss, Mrs, wife, madam
examples: 英 ['leɪdi] 美 ['leɪdi]
n.夫人；女士
(1) The lady looked at me with a contented smile.(2) The lady assured to him her daughter.(3) The antique table went to the lady in the pink hat.(4) He handed the old lady out of the cab.
(1) 那位夫人带着满意的微笑看着我。(2) 夫人把女儿许配给他。(3) 这张古董桌子卖给那位戴粉红色帽子的女士了。(4) 他将这位上了年纪的女士从车上扶下来。
[sound:youdao-e764ea0d-6ecf5d0d-490e88a9-b4c8ccf2-566b1c15.mp3]

translation:
vi. 走得极慢，落后
vt. 落后于; 给…加上外套; 把…关进牢里; 逮捕
n. 滞后，（两事件之间的）时间间隔; 囚犯; 防护套; 桶板

时态：lagged, lagging, lags
分布：落后(93%)，时间间隔(5%)，缓慢进行(1%)，减退(1%)


→词源不详，可能来自lug,用力拖拉。引申词义缓慢，滞后。
v./n.落后,滞后vt.用隔热材料覆盖(锅炉等)The lagging man tagged the bags among the luggage with small flags.落伍者给行李中的袋子加上小旗标签.
【记】身上长了两条lag，而不是leg所以走得比较慢－落后。【参】laggard（n 落后者；adj 缓慢的）；sluggard（n 懒人）【反】forge ahead（稳步前进）



verb (-gg-)MOVE SLOWLY  缓慢移动  intransitive ■to move or make progress so slowly that you are behind other people or things 缓慢移动；掉队，滞后
•He's lagging behind a bit - I think we'd better wait for him to catch us up.他有点脱队了——我看我们最好等他赶上来。

•Sales are lagging at the moment.目前的销售很不景气。

[læg] verb (-gg-)COVER  覆盖  transitive ■to cover something with a thick layer of material in order to stop heat from escaping or to stop water from freezing （为保温而）覆盖，（为防止结冰而）给…加保温层
•to lag pipes给管道加保温层

[læg] verb (-gg-)PRISON  监狱  transitive Australian informal ■to send someone to prison or to arrest someone 使入狱，逮捕
[læg] noun countable DELAY  延迟  ■a delay between two things happening （两件事之间的）间隔，延迟
•You have to allow for a time lag between order and delivery.订货和送货之间要有一段时间间隔。

[læg] noun countable PRISONER  囚犯  UK old-fashioned informal ■a prisoner or a person who has often been a prisoner in the past 囚犯，犯人；惯犯
•an old lag惯犯




n. 落后；迟延；防护套；囚犯；桶板
 - backwardness, prisoner
vt. 落后于；押往监狱；加上外套
 - trail, take the dust of
vi. [电子] 滞后；缓缓而行；蹒跚
 - file over, titubate
adj. 最后的
 - finishing, last, eventual, rearmost, dernier
examples: 英 [læɡ] 美 [læɡ]
v.落后；减退；缓慢进行n.落后；时间间隔

(1) Some of the runners in the race began to lag.(2) The children always lag behind when we go for a walk.(3) Interest lags in such matters.(4) It takes a lot of time to catch up with a cultural lag.(5) There was a long lag in forwarding mail to us.
(1) 参加比赛的运动员中有一些开始落後了。(2) 我们出去散步时，孩子们总是落在后面。(3) 对这类事情的兴趣慢慢减少了。(4) 文化的落后需要长时间才能赶上。(5) 转寄给我们的邮件晚了很久才拿到。
[sound:youdao-00612419-2a12433a-22cc8e8e-a4d8be54-2d0381fa.mp3]

translation:
n. 湖; 深红色颜料; 胭脂红; [化]色淀
vt. &vi. 血球溶解; 使（血液）发生血球溶解

分布：湖(91%)，湖泊(8%)，深红色(1%)


→来自拉丁语lacus,湖泊，池塘，来自laku,滴，渗透，词源同leak,loch,lough.
n.湖泊,湖水The wakened cake baker awakes to that he has to brake by the lake.被唤醒的蛋糕师傅醒悟到他必须在湖边刹车.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a large area of water surrounded by land and not connected to the sea except by rivers or streams 湖，湖泊
•We used to go boating on that lake.我们过去常去那个湖里划船。

•Lake Windermere温德米尔湖
milk/oil/wine, etc. lake disapproving ■when too much of a liquid product is produced, making it necessary to store it or waste it （因过量生产而出现的）奶／油／酒湖等
•Overproduction caused butter mountains and wine lakes.生产过剩导致奶油堆积如山、葡萄酒汇流成河。




n. [地理] 湖；深红色颜料；胭脂红
 - lacus, loch
examples: 英 [leɪk] 美 [leɪk]
n.湖；湖泊n.深红色；[化]色淀

(1) The garden reaches the lake.(2) We crossed the lake in a canoe.(3) I reached the gate that opened towards the lake.(4) Anyone swimming in this lake does so at his own risk.(5) The river fed into a lake.(6) The lake was encircled by trees.(7) I've just run out of crimson lake paint.
(1) 花园一直延伸到湖边。(2) 我们乘独木舟过河。(3) 我走到临湖而开的那扇门前。(4) 任何人在此湖中冒险游泳，其后果自负。(5) 这条河流入一个湖泊。(6) 该湖泊被树林环抱。(7) 我正好用完了胭脂红色的颜料。

limb
→词源不详。
n.羔羊,小羊;羔羊肉L-of God (=the Lamb)【宗】耶稣基督.



noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■a young sheep, or the flesh of a young sheep eaten as meat 羊羔，小羊；羊羔肉
•lambs gambolling about in the fields在牧场上跳来跳去的一群羊羔
•lamb chops羊排
•roast lamb烤羊肉
⇒ See also mutton
[læm] noun countable or uncountable Lamb of God ■in the Christian religion, a name for Christ 上帝的羔羊（基督的别称）
[læm] noun countable or uncountable like a lamb to the slaughter ■If a person does something or goes somewhere like a lamb to the slaughter, they do it without knowing that something bad is going to happen and therefore act calmly and without fighting against the situation. 如同待宰羔羊，温顺地

n. [食品]  [畜牧] 羔羊，小羊；羔羊肉

examples: 英 [læm] 美 [læm]
n.小羊；羔羊肉；羔羊；温顺的人vi.产羊羔

(1) The lamb had to be brought up by hand.(2) The dying lamb fell, its legs flailing (about) helplessly.(3) Veal is young beef and lamb is a baby sheep.(4) The little lamb was caught by the wolf.(5) The lamb had to be brought up by hand.(6) The sheep are lambing this week.(7) She's due to lamb in two weeks' time.
(1) 这只小羊要用奶瓶喂养。(2) 小羊快要死了，倒在地上四条腿又踢又蹬。(3) 小牛肉是小牛犊身上的肉，小羊肉是羔羊身上的肉。(4) 小羔羊被狼抓住了。(5) 这只小羊要用奶瓶喂养。(6) 这个星期绵羊要产羔。(7) 母羊还有两个星期就要产羔了。

translation:
adj. 跛的，瘸的; 僵痛的; 差劲的，无说服力的; 蹩脚的
vi. 变跛
vt. 使跛，使残废; 把…弄残废
n. （金属）薄板，薄片; （古代护身甲上的）重叠金属片

时态：lamed, laming, lames
分布：跛足的(54%)，无说服力的(25%)，金属薄板(14%)，使 ... 成残废(7%)


→来自lem,击，打，词源同lam,lambaste.引申词义打跛，跛的。lame 金银锦缎
a.跛的,(辩解,论据等)无说服力的The shameless lame man is to blame for the flaming frame.无耻的跛子应为燃烧的框架负责.



adjective UNABLE TO WALK  无法行走的  ■(especially of animals) not able to walk correctly because of physical injury to or weakness in the legs or feet （尤指动物）瘸的，一瘸一拐的
[leɪm] adjective NOT SATISFACTORY  不令人满意的  ■(especially of an excuse or argument) weak and unsatisfactory （尤指借口或论据）站不住脚的，无说服力的
•a lame excuse站不住脚的借口





cripple, lame

这组词都有“使跛，使残废”的意思，其区别是：
cripple: 正式用词，语气较强。多指因伤、体弱或疾病等所导致的永久性残废，常为肢体不全，行走不便，甚至移动身体也困难。
lame: 普通用词，指因受伤或本身的生理缺陷而使人的身体致残，着重行走时的不便。


adj. 跛足的；僵痛的；不完全的；无说服力的
 - incomplete, half
vi. 变跛
 - founder
vt. 使跛；使成残废
 - cripple
examples: 英 [leɪm] 美 [leɪm]
adj.无说服力的；跛足的vt.使 ... 成残废n.金属薄板

(1) He gave a lame excuse for being late.(2) Mary offered only a lame apology.(3) He is lame in one leg and walks with the help of a crutch.(4) The work was hard for the lame old man.(5) The accident made him lame in the left leg(6) You must not lame me for that; it was not my fault
(1) 他说了个站不住脚的理由解释他迟到的原因。(2) 玛丽只作了一个站不住脚的辩解。(3) 他的一条腿跛了，走路借助于拐杖。(4) 这工作对他这个跛脚的老先生来说是很辛苦的。(5) 出事後他的左腿瘸了(6) 你不应为那件事责备我，那不是我的过失。
[sound:youdao-edb11be9-fbe854c5-d97f9143-c72bc581-36ba4458.mp3]

translation:
n. 灯; 发热灯，照射灯

分布：灯(86%)，台灯(7%)，油灯(6%)，光源(1%)


→来自lap,照耀，发光，词源同lantern,插入鼻音字母m.可能同leuk,发光，照明，词源同light,lucid.
n.灯He stamped on the stamps and slammed the lamp on the damp dam.他用脚踩邮票并将灯砰地摔在潮湿的坝上.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something （尤指带灯罩的）灯
•an electric/oil/gas lamp电／油／煤气灯

•a street lamp路灯

•a table/bedside lamp枱／床头灯
⇒ See also sunlamp ADVANCED  ■any of various devices that produce particular types of light 照明设备，照射器
•an infrared lamp红外线照射灯





lamp, light

这组词都有“灯”的意思，其区别是：
lamp: 通常指以油、气或电为能源的照明设备，一般有罩。
light: 普通用词，含义广泛。泛指一切供照明的灯，多指电灯。


n. [电] 灯；照射器
 - light
vt. 照亮
 - light up, lumine
vi. 发亮
 - brighten up, resplend
examples: 英 [læmp] 美 [læmp]
n.灯；台灯；油灯；光源

(1) The lamp hung over the table.(2) The lamp was set on my desk for me to study at night.(3) In our village, electric light has taken the place of oil lamp.(4) The flower was clearly outlined in the light of the lamp.
(1) 那盏灯悬挂在桌子上方。(2) 台灯放在我的书桌上,好让我晚上可以学习。(3) 在我们村庄,电灯已经取代了油灯。(4) 花朵在阳光下清晰地显现出轮廓。
[sound:youdao-a2f1a219-c7472fb6-c6a50eb6-677ce7c2-c21c5433.mp3]

translation:
n. 陆地; 国家; 地产; 土地
vt. & vi. （使）登岸; 降临; 使陷于（困境）; 使不得不应付
vt. 自船上卸下; 获得; 捕到; 钓到（鱼）
vi. 跳落，跌落，被抛落（地面）

时态：landed, landing, lands
分布：土地(71%)，陆地(12%)，着陆(7%)，国土(3%)，得到(3%)，靠岸(1%)，使靠岸(1%)，使着陆(1%)，跌落地面(1%)


→来自landh,土地，荒野，词源同lawn.
n.陆地,土地,国家v.(使)靠岸(登陆,降落)The landlord's land on the highland of the mainland expanded a lot.地主在大陆高原上的土地扩张了很多.



noun DRY SURFACE  干燥的表面   ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■the surface of the Earth that is not covered by water 陆地，地面
•It is cheaper to drill for oil on land than at sea.在陆地上钻探石油比在海上更经济。

•The treaty has led to a dramatic reduction in the number of land -based missiles in Europe.该条约的签订导致了欧洲陆基导弹的数量大幅减少。

•The military commanders won't deploy their land forces until they're satisfied that the air attacks have done their job.军队指挥官们将一直等到他们觉得空中打击奏效了之后才会开始部署地面部队。
 ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■an area of ground, especially when used for a particular purpose such as farming or building 地，土地
•This sort of land is no good for growing potatoes.这种地不适合种马铃薯。

•I always prosecute people who trespass on my land.对擅自闯入我的领地的人我一律都要告上法庭。

•We want to buy a plot of land to build a house.我们想买一块地盖房子。
the land ■farms, farming and the countryside 农场；务农；农村
•Most of the families lived off the land (= grew their own food etc.).大多数家庭靠种田过活。

•My parents worked (on) the land.我父母都务农。

[lænd] noun COUNTRY  国家   ADVANCED  countable literary ■a country 国家
•a land of ice and snow冰雪的国度

•The group want to promote their ideas in schools throughout the land.该团体到全国各地的学校去宣传他们的理念。
⇒ See also fatherland;homeland;motherland
[lænd] noun be in the land of nod old-fashioned informal ■to be sleeping 正在睡觉，在睡梦中
•Jamie's in the land of nod at last.杰米终于睡着了。

[lænd] noun be in the land of the living humorous ■to be awake or to be alive 醒着；活着
•She was partying till the early hours, so I don't imagine she'll be in the land of the living before lunchtime.她在晚会上一直玩到后半夜，所以我想午饭之前她是不会睡醒的。

[lænd] noun find out / see how the land lies ■to wait until you have all the available information about a situation before you take any action （采取行动之前）弄清情况，摸清形势
[lænd] noun land of milk and honey ■a country where living conditions are good and people have the opportunity to make a lot of money 鱼米之乡，富饶的国度
•Many Mexicans regard the United States as a land of milk and honey.许多墨西哥人把美国看作是富裕的乐土。

[lænd] noun the land of the midnight sun ■the part of Norway, Sweden and Finland inside the Arctic Circle where the sun is in the sky very late at night in the summer 午夜太阳国（指挪威、瑞典、芬兰等国位于北极圈内的国土）
[lænd] noun the Land of the Rising Sun ■Japan 日不落国（指日本）
[lænd] verb ARRIVE  到达   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to (cause to) arrive at a place after moving down through the air （使）着陆，（使）落地，（使）降落
•We should land in Madrid at 7am.我们将于早上7点钟飞抵马德里。

•You can land a plane on water in an emergency.紧急情况下飞机可以迫降在水上。

•figurative The report first landed on my desk this morning.这份报告最初是在今天早上出现在我的桌上。
 ADVANCED  intransitive ■to arrive in a boat 到岸，到港
•We landed at Port Said in the early evening.傍晚时分我们乘船抵达赛伊德港。

[lænd] verb UNLOAD  卸下  transitive ■to unload people or things from a ship or aircraft onto the ground 使上岸；使下飞机；（从船或飞机上）卸下（货物）
•The general's plan involved landing troops behind enemy lines.将军的计划包括向敌人后方空投部队。

[lænd] verb CATCH  抓住  transitive ■to catch a fish with a hook (= curved piece of wire) or net and remove it from the water 钓到，网到（鱼）
•He landed a huge salmon.他钓到了一条很大的鲑鱼。

[lænd] verb ACHIEVE  取得  transitive ■to get or achieve something good, especially in a way which seems easy or unexpected （尤指轻而易举或意外地）获得，得到，赢得
•He's just landed a senior editorial job.他刚刚轻而易举地得到了一份资深编辑的工作。

[lænd] verb land on your feet ■to return to a good situation after experiencing problems, especially because of good luck rather than skill or hard work 时来运转，峰回路转，柳暗花明
•She's really landed on her feet with this new job.她找到这份新工作后真是时来运转了。

[lænd] verb   Phrasal Verbs   land sb in sth ■to cause someone to be in a difficult situation 使（某人）陷入困境
•Revealing confidential information to a rival company could land you in serious trouble with your boss.向竞争对手泄露公司秘密的话，你的老板不会轻饶了你。

•The demonstration outside the embassy landed some of the protesters in jail overnight.在使馆外举行抗议示威活动导致一些抗议者被拘留了一夜。

•He landed himself in deep/hot water (= in a very difficult or unpleasant situation) by lying to the tax office about his earnings.他因向税务部门谎报收入而惹上了大麻烦。

[lænd] verb   Phrasal Verbs   land up informal ■to finally be in a particular place, state or situation, especially without having planned it （尤指在事先未作计划的情况下）最终到达（某位置）；结果处于（某种处境）
•When we accepted that lift in Paris, we never expected to land up in Athens.我们在巴黎搭那趟便车时根本没想到会来到雅典。

•He'll land up in hospital if he carries on drinking like that.如果他继续那么喝酒，他最终准会被送进医院。

[lænd] verb   Phrasal Verbs   land sb with sth ■If someone or something lands you with something, they cause problems for you 给（某人）惹下（麻烦），给（某人）出（难题）
•I hope you don't mind me landing you with the children at such short notice.希望你不会介意我这么急着把孩子们交给你来照顾。

•Alan's gone off on holiday and I've been landed with the job of sorting out his mistakes.艾伦去渡假了，结果改正他的差错的差使就落到了我头上。





land, state, power, nation, country

这组词都有“国家”的意思，其区别是：
land: 常用于文学中，侧重国土，带感情色彩。
state: 正式用词，指政治概念上的国家，即由政府所代表的国家。
power: 特指拥有强大军事力量，在国际事务中有较强权威或影响的国家，即强国、大国。
nation: 普通用词，指在某一国土定居的人民、民族，强调人民。
country: 普通用词，侧重国土与人民。



clay, mud, dust, ground, land, earth, dirt, soil

这组词都有“土地，土，泥”的意思，其区别是：
clay: 特指潮湿时发粘，而火烤后变坚硬的泥土。
mud: 指湿土，尤指雨后稀泥、污泥。
dust: 特指土壤干燥后，飞扬于空中的细微泥土。
ground: 通常指大地的表面，也可指土壤、泥土或场地。
land: 含义笼统。指与河流、海洋相对的陆地，也指可耕种的土地。
earth: 多指地表带有水分的泥土，较具体。
dirt: 指地表的干松泥土。
soil: 特指适宜栽种农作物或生长各种植物的泥土。


n. 国土； [地理] 陆地；地面
 - floor, continent
vi. 登陆；到达
 - come in, get in
examples: 英 [lænd] 美 [lænd]
n.陆地；国土；土地v.靠岸；着陆；跌落地面；得到；使靠岸；使着陆

(1) We are glad to be on land again.(2) The river passes through our land.(3) The land is laid down with red or white clover.(4) This land was reclaimed from the sea.(5) The ship landed safely in the end.(6) In ten minutes the plane will land in Beijing.(7) He fell down the stairs, landing in a heap at the bottom.(8) The young man was lucky to land a good job .
(1) 我们很高兴又踏上陆地了。(2) 这条河流经我们的国土(3) 这块土地种上了红花和白花苜蓿。(4) 这块土地是填海开垦出来的。(5) 船最后平安靠岸了。(6) 飞机十分钟后将会在北京着陆。(7) 他从楼梯上摔下来，直跌到楼梯底部滚成一团。(8) 那个年轻人幸运地得到了一个好工作。
[sound:youdao-dd26cdd2-dfffb4db-0f5d16b3-ed0f4752-235fd934.mp3]

translation:
n. 登陆，着陆; 终点; 登陆处; 楼梯的过渡平台
v. （使）登陆(land的现在分词)

分布：着陆(58%)，登陆(32%)，楼梯平台(7%)，登陆处(2%)，动词land的现在分词.(1%)


noun countable PLANE  飞机   ADVANCED  ■an arrival on the ground of an aircraft or boat 着陆；靠岸
•One person has died after the pilot of a light aircraft was forced to make a crash/emergency landing in a field.飞行员驾驶轻型飞机在田地里迫降／紧急着陆后有一人死亡。

translation:
n. 小路，小巷; 航道，空中走廊，规定的单向行车道; 车道; [篮球]罚球区

分布：小巷(38%)，小路(35%)，航道(11%)，跑道(8%)，行车道(8%)


→来自Proto-Germanic*lano,小巷，通道，来自le,走，移动，词源可能同lead.
n.小路,小巷,行车道In the lane the planer saw a planet airplane under the crane.在巷道里,刨工看见了起重机下的行星飞机.



noun countable ROAD  路   IMPROVER  ■a narrow road in the countryside or in a town 乡间小路；小巷，小街，胡同
•He drives so fast along those narrow country lanes.在那些狭窄的乡间小路上他把车开得飞快。

•I live at the end of Church Lane.我住在教堂巷的最里面。

[leɪn] noun countable STRIP  条带  ■a special strip of a road, sports track or swimming pool that is used to keep vehicles or competitors separate 车道；（田径比赛的）跑道，泳道
•a bus/cycle lane公车／脚踏车车道

•The northbound lane is closed because of an accident.北上的车道因发生事故已经封闭。

•I find driving in the fast lane rather stressful.我发现在快车道行驶时精神非常紧张。

•The British runners/swimmers are in lanes 4 and 6.英国径赛／游泳选手处在第四道和第六道。
■a route through the sea or the air which ships or aircraft regularly sail or fly along 航道，航线
•The English Channel is the busiest shipping lane in the world.英吉利海峡是世界上最繁忙的水运航道。





motorway（free way，express way）, vessel, pavement（sidewalk）, highway, route, trail, street, way, road, channel, lane

motorway（free way，express way）: 高速公路；
vessel: 血管，管道，一般指细小管道；
pavement（sidewalk）: 街道两旁的人行道；
highway: 通常指市区外可以通行各种机动车辆的交通干线;
route: 路线，航线；path：乡间小路，公园小径；
trail: 指人或兽在森林、荒野或山中踩出的小径或崎岖小道
street: 尤指城市中的道路；
way: 可指各种路、道或通道，也可指抽象的道路、方法；
road: 广阔平坦的大道，多指公路；
channel: 海峡，渠道，管道；
lane: 指农村或城镇的小道或小径，也指小巷；



highway, route, avenue, trail, street, path, motorway, way, road, pavement, lane

这组词都有“路”的意思，其区别是：
highway: 通常指市区外可以通行各种机动车辆的交通干线。
route: 指从此处通往彼处的路线、路程等。
avenue: 在美国，指城市中一侧或两侧建筑物林立的大道或马路；而在英国则常指通住乡村大住宅、私人大庄园或两旁栽树的道路。
trail: 指人或兽在森林、荒野或山中踩出的小径或崎岖小道。
street: 尤指城市中的道路，往往一侧或两侧有高大建筑物；还可指城市小镇、近郊可供人、车、马行走的平坦道路。
path: 多指由人或动物在田间、小丘或树丛中经常走动而踩出的小路，也指公园或花园等供人走的小径。
motorway: 高速公路，新词，特指为车辆快速通行而修的专线，美语为freeway或expressway。
way: 普通用词，含义广泛，可指各种路、道或通道，也可指抽象的道路。
road: 指连接两地间供行人或车辆使用的广阔平坦的大道，多指公路，也可用于引申意义。
pavement: 在英国，多指街道两旁的人行道，而美国人常用sidewlk表示人行道。
lane: 指农村或城镇的小道或小径，也指小巷。


n. [交] 车道；小巷； [航]  [水运] 航线
 - vector, driveway
examples: [联想] lame 瘸子走在 lane 小巷sane 明智的lame 瘸的,无说服力的lament 悲伤cripple 残废,跛,使残废
英 [leɪn] 美 [leɪn]
n.小路；小巷；行车道；跑道；航道

(1) The lane is the boundary of our land from theirs.(2) She drives carefully up the rocky lane.(3) That lane will take you to his house.(4) The lane was rutted with tyre tracks.(5) After overtaking you should move back into the inside lane.(6) The one in the second lane is in the lead now.(7) An ice gorge has blocked the shipping lane.
(1) 那条小路就是我们这片地与他们那片地的分界线。(2) 她驾车小心地从这条很多石头的小路上驶过去。(3) 你从那条小巷就可以走到他家。(4) 这小巷有车胎轧出的凹痕。(5) 超车后应回到内车道行驶。(6) 第二条跑道上的人现在跑在前面。(7) 冰块阻碍了航道。

translation:
n. 语言，语言文字; 表达能力; 言语，语风，文风，文体; 专门用语，术语

分布：语言(97%)，语言文字(2%)，表达方式(1%)


→来自拉丁语lingua,舌头，语言，词源同tongue,linguist.
n.语言,术语,(运用语言的)方式,风格The language angel hanged up the gang and banged them at the angle of the triangle.语文天使将那伙人吊起朝三角形的角上猛撞.



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■a system of communication consisting of sounds, words and grammar, or the system of communication used by the people of a particular country or profession 语言
•She does research into how children acquire language.她研究儿童是如何习得语言的。

•Do you speak any foreign languages?"你会说外语吗？

•I'm hopeless at learning languages.我根本不是学语言的料。

•the English language英语

•legal/technical language法律专业用语／术语

•the language of business商业用语

•Java and Perl are both important computer programming languages (= systems of writing instructions for computers).Java 和 Perl 都是重要的电脑程式设计语言。

['læŋ.gwɪdʒ] noun countable or uncountable speak / talk the same language ■to have similar ideas and similar ways of expressing them 有共同语言
•We come from similar backgrounds, so we speak the same language.我们的出身相似，所以有共同语言。





lexicon, term, vocabulary, word, language

这组词都有“文字，词，语言”的意思，其区别是：
lexicon: 指某种语言、某人或某一知识领域的全部词汇。
term: 指有特定意义的词，词语或术语。
vocabulary: 集合名词，指词汇、语汇或词汇量。
word: 普通用词，指语言的最小单位的单词、字，也可指话、整句话或一段话。
language: 普通用词，指国家、民族或种族内部使用，已经系统化的语言。


n. [语] 语言；语言文字；表达能力
 - tongue, parole
examples: 英 ['læŋɡwɪdʒ] 美 ['læŋɡwɪdʒ]
n.语言；语言文字；表达方式

(1) Chinese is my native language.(2) What languages can you speak?(3) A dictionary is an invaluable aid in learning a new language.(4) She reduced his theories to simple language.(5) Sign language is a neat way to express yourself.
(1) 汉语是我的母语。(2) 你会说什么语言？(3) 在学习一种新语言时,辞典是非常有用的工具。(4) 她将他的理论以简单的语言文字表达出来。(5) 手语是一种表达你自己的优雅方式。

translation:
vt. 折叠; 包裹，缠绕; 使搭接; 磨亮，磨平
vi. 折叠; 部分重叠; 舔; 包围
n. 膝; 下摆; 一圈跑道; 范围

时态：lapped, lapping, laps
分布：重叠部分(23%)，轻拍(17%)，舐(15%)，领先一圈(15%)，包围(15%)，膝部(9%)，控制范围(3%)，舔食(3%)


→1.来自古英语laeppa,挂布，衣摆，裙摆，词源同label,lapel，后用来指遮膝盖的裙摆，膝盖，大腿。
n.大腿,(跑道的)一圈,一段路程,工作阶段With time elapsing, the flaps collapse up on his clapper's lap.随着时间流逝,袋盖在拍手者的膝上堆叠起来.



noun LEGS  腿   ADVANCED  countable usually singular ■the top surface of the upper part of the legs of a person who is sitting down （坐着时的）大腿部
•Come and sit on my lap and I'll read you a story.过来坐在我的腿上，我念故事给你听。

[læp] noun RACING  赛跑  countable ■a complete journey around a race track that is repeated several times during a competition （跑道的）一圈，一周
•He recorded the fastest lap in last weekend's Hungarian Grand Prix.在上周的匈牙利大奖赛中他创造了最快单圈成绩纪录。

•After a strong start, she was passed by several runners in/on the final/last lap and finished ninth.她在起跑阶段很有优势，但在最后一圈时被几名选手超出，最终获得了第九名。
lap of honour UK (US victory lap) ■a journey around a track or sports field that is made by a winner of a race or a team that has won a game （赢得比赛胜利后的）绕场庆祝
[læp] noun in the lap of luxury ■living in very comfortable conditions because you have a lot of money 生活优裕，养尊处优
[læp] noun in the lap of the gods UK ■describes a situation that cannot be controlled and which depends only on good luck 全靠运气，碰运气，听天由命
•The doctors have done everything possible for him, so his recovery now is in the lap of the gods.医生已为他尽了全力，能否恢复现在就全靠运气了。

[læp] verb (-pp-)RACING  赛跑  transitive ■to go past someone in a race who has been round the track one less time than you （在赛跑中）领先一圈（或数圈）
•He finished last after being lapped twice by the leading runners.他最后一个到达终点，被领先的选手落下了整整两圈。
intransitive ■to make one complete journey around a track 跑完一圈
[læp] verb (-pp-)DRINK  喝  transitive ■(of an animal) to drink a liquid by taking it in small amounts into the mouth with a lot of short quick movements of the tongue （动物）舔食，舔着喝
[læp] verb (-pp-)HIT GENTLY  轻打  intransitive or transitive ■(of waves) to hit something gently, producing quiet sounds （波浪）轻轻地拍击，轻轻地敲打
•The water lapped against the side of the pool.水轻轻地拍打着水池的池壁。

•The waves gently lapped the shore.波浪轻轻地拍打着海岸。

[læp] verb (-pp-)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] lap sth up ■to enjoy something very much 非常喜欢；乐于接受
•We walked around the city, lapping up the atmosphere.我们在市内漫步，欣喜地欣赏着周围的一切。

•Everyone clapped and cheered and you could see he was lapping it up.大家都在鼓掌欢呼，可以看出他对此感到非常受用。




n. 一圈；膝盖；下摆；山坳
 - circuit, knee
vt. 使重叠；拍打；包围
 - invest, case, wash
vi. 重叠；轻拍；围住
 - tap, close in on
examples: [联想] instant是瞬间的；constant是连续的instance   例子、举例instantaneous  adj.瞬间的；即刻的；猝发的
英 [læp] 美 [læp]
n.膝部；（衣服的）下摆；控制范围n.重叠部分；(跑道的)一圈n.舐；（波浪）拍打声v.包围；（使）重叠；领先一圈v.舔食；轻拍

(1) The child sat on its mother's lap.(2) For quite some time, everything fell into his lap.(3) The leading car crashed midway through the tenth lap.(4) The cat lapped up the milk.(5) He heard the lap of the waves.(6) The two pictures are made to lap over each other.(7) Hyperparasitic effect was observed at culture over lap of Cylindrocladium spathiphylli and some phytopathogen through microscope.(8) The waves gently lap against the shore.
(1) 小孩坐在妈妈的膝上。(2) 好长一段时间他事事称心如意。(3) 领先的那辆赛车在第十圈的中途撞毁了。(4) 猫舔食牛奶。(5) 他听到了波浪的拍打声。(6) 那两张画被重叠在一起。(7) 显微观察对峙培养的重叠区域，发现苞叶芋柱帚霉对部分病原菌有重寄生现象。(8) 海浪轻轻地拍打着海岸。
[sound:youdao-23ce45d5-1e3c52db-77ae8775-ddf97103-2c987c89.mp3]

translation:
adv. 大大地; 夸大地; 详细地; 顺风地
adj. 大的; 大规模的; 大型号的; 广泛的
v. 玩个痛快; （尤指跳舞和饮酒）作乐

级别：larger, largest
分布：大的(58%)，大量的(25%)，广泛的(6%)，夸大地(6%)，大号的(4%)，狂欢作乐(1%)


→来自拉丁语largus,大的，丰富的，充满的。
a.大的,广大的,大规模的The concert drew a large audience.音乐会吸引了大量的观众.



US [lɑ:rdʒ] adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■big in size or amount 大的；大规模的；大量的
•a large house大房子

•the world's largest computer manufacturer世界上最大的电脑制造商

•We need a larger car.我们需要一辆更大的车。

•We didn't expect such a large number of people to attend the concert.我们没想到会有这么多人来听音乐会。

•We've made good progress, but there's still a large amount of work to be done.我们已经取得了一些进展，但仍有大量的工作要做。

•There was a larger-than-expected fall in unemployment last month.上个月的失业人数比预计数字减少了很多。

•Researchers have just completed the largest-ever survey of criminal behaviour in the UK.研究人员刚刚完成了英国历史上最大规模的犯罪行为调查。

•The population faces starvation this winter without large-scale emergency food aid.今年冬天由于没有大规模的紧急食物援助，人们将面临饥荒。

UK [lɑ:dʒ] US [lɑ:rdʒ] adjective by and large ■when everything about a situation is considered together 大体上，总体上，一般来讲
•There are a few small things that I don't like about my job, but by and large it's very enjoyable.虽然有些小的地方让我不太满意，但总的来讲我还是很喜欢这份工作的。

UK [lɑ:dʒ] US [lɑ:rdʒ] adjective (as) large as life ■used as a way of describing a person you see, and are surprised to see, in a particular place （表示见到某人本人感到惊奇）本人，本身
•I looked up from my newspaper and there he was, as large as life, Tim Trotter!我看完报纸抬起头来，竟意外地看到了蒂姆‧特罗特，真的是他本人，一点也没错。

UK [lɑ:dʒ] US [lɑ:rdʒ] adjective larger than life ■If someone is larger than life, they attract a lot of attention because they are more exciting or interesting than most people 更有趣的，更活跃的（因此可能更引人注目）
•Most characters in his films are somewhat larger than life.在他的电影中，大多数人物都是超群不凡之辈。

UK [lɑ:dʒ] US [lɑ:rdʒ] noun at large ■generally 普遍地，全体地
•This group is not representative of the population at large.这个团体不是全体人民的代表。

UK [lɑ:dʒ] US [lɑ:rdʒ] noun be at large ■If someone dangerous is at large, they are free when they should not be 逍遥法外，尚未捉拿归案
•Twelve prisoners are at large following a series of escapes.一连串的越狱事件发生后，12名犯人目前依然逍遥法外。

UK [lɑ:dʒ] US [lɑ:rdʒ] verb larging it ■informal enjoying yourself very much by spending a lot of money, often in a way that attracts attention 纵情享乐的，肆意享受的
•We were larging it at a club last night.昨晚我们在俱乐部纵情玩乐了一番。





great, grand, big, large

这组词都有“大的”的意思，其区别是：
great: 普通用词，可指具体东西的“大”，但更常指事物的重要，人的行为、品格的伟大等，带一定的感情色彩。
grand: 侧重指盛大、绝大，有气派。
big: 常用词，使用广泛，较口语化。多指体积、重量或容量等方面的“大”，有时也用于描写抽象之物。
large: 普通用词，含义广，指体积、面积、容量、数量以及程度等方面的大，具体或抽象意义均可用。


adj. 大的；多数的；广博的
 - big, most
adv. 大大地；夸大地
 - greatly, tall, big
n. 大
 - bigness
examples: 英 [lɑːdʒ] 美 [lɑːrdʒ]
adj.大的；大量的；大号的；广泛的adv.夸大地；[航海]顺风地v.狂欢作乐

(1) Shanghai is a large city.(2) The oceans are large bodies of water.(3) The hill was surmounted with a large castle.(4) The concert drew a large audience.(5) He has a large amount of mail to answer every day.(6) He has a large number of reference books at his disposal.(7) You should change from the small to a large size.(8) This issue is so large and the process was so lengthy.(9) The President is a man of large experience.(10) He tends to talk large.
(1) 上海是一个大城市。(2) 海洋是广大的水域。(3) 小山上有一座巨大的城堡。(4) 音乐会吸引了大量的观众。(5) 他每天有大量的信件要回复。(6) 他有大量的参考书可供使用。(7) 你必须把这件小号的衣服换成大号。(8) 这个问题如此广泛，过程又如此漫长。(9) 总统是一位经验丰富的人。(10) 他喜欢讲大话。

translation:
adv. 大部分地，主要地; 大规模地; 丰富地

分布：主要地(66%)，大部分(34%)


ad.主要地,基本上;大量地,大规模地His success was largely due to his diligence.他的成功大半由于努力.



US ['lɑ:rdʒ-] adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■almost completely 主要地；大多；在很大程度上
•a largely male company员工大多为男性的公司

•Their complaints have been largely ignored.他们的抱怨几乎没有引起任何重视。

•Until recently the civil war had been largely unreported in the press.直到最近报纸才开始报道那场内战。





principally, mainly, generally, largely, chiefly, primarily, mostly, greatly

这组词都有“主要地，大量地”的意思，其区别是：
principally: 侧重居首要地位。
mainly: 指主要部分，突出在一系列事物中的相对重要性。
generally: 通常强调普遍性。
largely: 着重范围或分量大大超过别的成分。
chiefly: 侧重某人或某物在众多的人或物中占主要和显著地位。
primarily: 侧重基本地，首要地。
mostly: 强调数量占多半，近乎全部。
greatly: 通常强调程度的高。


adv. 主要地；大部分；大量地
 - mainly, basically, mostly, primarily, freely
examples: 英 ['lɑːdʒli] 美 ['lɑːrdʒli]
adv.大部分；主要地

(1) The farming area is centered largely in the south.(2) His eight sons largely inherited his fortune.(3) We'll be dealing largely with the same themes, but from different angles.(4) However, in the East, there were many solar deities, including the Greek Helios, who was largely displaced by Apollo.
(1) 农业区大部分集中在南方。(2) 他的八个儿子继承了他的大部分遗产。(3) 我们将从不同的角度主要地研究这一课题。(4) 然而，在东方，有很多太阳神，包括希腊的太阳神，主要地是以阿波罗来命名。
[sound:youdao-ce6ee6a5-dc0256ff-cd0fc0c3-39f76f88-da3c53f6.mp3]

translation:
n. 激光; 激光器，镭射器

分布：激光(98%)，镭射(2%)


→首字母缩写词，来自light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.
n.激光In occasional case the phrase emphasizes the importance of the phase to the laser.在偶然情况下该短句强调了相位对于激光的重要性.



US [-zɚ] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■(a device which produces) a powerful narrow beam of light that can be used as a tool to cut metal, to perform medical operations, or to create patterns of light for entertainment 雷射（器）
•laser beam雷射光束

•laser surgery雷射手术
examples: 英 ['leɪzə(r)] 美 ['leɪzər]
n.激光；镭射

(1) Lasers can be used to perform operations nowadays.(2) He monopolizes the laser printer.(3) The doctor finished the operation, but his success depended on the backroom boys who had invented the new laser scalpel.(4) A laser reflection will occur at each laminate substrate.
(1) 现在激光可以用来做手术。(2) 他独占了这台激光打印机。(3) 医生做完了手术，但他的成功有赖于那些发明了新型激光手术刀的研究人员。(4) 每一片玻璃都会产生一个镭射反射。
[sound:youdao-1a3084e2-90bb721a-7eab3db5-0d705906-2ea81224.mp3]

translation:
adv. 近来，最近; 不久以前

分布：最近(100%)


ad.最近,不久前The missionary transmitted emission emitted lately.传教士传播了新近散发出来的散发物.



adverb ■recently 最近，近来
•I haven't been feeling so well lately.最近我一直有些不舒服。

•Have you been doing anything interesting lately?最近你做了甚么有趣的事吗？





initially, afterward, subsequently, ultimately, lately, previously, eventually, shortly, presently

initially: 最初，开头
afterward: 以后，后来
subsequently: 随后，后来
ultimately: 最后，终于
lately: 最近，不久前
previously: 以前，先前
eventually: 终于，后来
shortly: 立刻，马上
presently: 马上，一会儿，很快



late, lately

late: 迟,晚,
lately: 最近,近来 I haven't seen him lately.



recently, lately

recently: 可用来指一段时间，也可指某一时刻
lately: 用来指一段时间，常用现在完成进行时；


adv. 近来，不久前
 - of late, odd-come-shortly
examples: 英 ['leɪtli] 美 ['leɪtli]
adv.最近

(1) I haven't had enough sleep lately.(2) I've not been feeling very well lately.(3) I haven't heard any news from my son lately.(4) Frank has taken up with Lucy lately.(5) That kind of bird has become more numerous around here lately.
(1) 最近我睡眠不足。(2) 我最近一直感觉不太好。(3) 我最近没听到我儿子的任何音讯。(4) 弗兰克最近经常与露西往来。(5) 近来在附近一带那种鸟越来越多了。
[sound:youdao-d8fe4f7c-bbf30ee9-847de5f4-01bd64c6-9efa5c0e.mp3]

translation:
adv. 较晚地; 以后，过后; 后来; 随后
adj. 后来的; 以后的; 接近末期的; 晚年的

分布：后来(40%)，以后的(21%)，接近末期的(13%)，后来的(13%)，稍后(13%)


→来自later的比较级形式。
ad.后来,过后The lace placed in the palace is replaced first, and displaced later.放在皇宫的带子先被替换,后来被转移.



US [-tˌɚ] adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■at a time in the future or after the time you have mentioned 晚些时候；过些时间
•He'll be back later.他稍后回来。

•We could always go later in the season.我们总还可以在这个季节的晚些时候去。

•Police questioned him and he was later arrested.警方审问了他，后来他被逮捕了。
later on  ADVANCED  ■at a time in the future, or after the time you have mentioned 将来的某个时候；在某个提及的时间以后
•What are you doing later on this evening?今晚晚些时候你想做甚么？

•Shall I go and fetch her later on?我过一会去接她好吗？

•Later on, we could go and have a meal if you like.你愿意的话，过一会我们可以一起去吃饭。
no/not later than ■not after 早于某个时间；在某时间之前
•She said she'd prefer us to arrive no later than nine o'clock.她说她希望我们能在九点之前到达。

UK ['leɪ.tər] US [-tˌɚ] adverb See/Catch you later. informal ■a way of saying goodbye 回头见，再见
•"Bye." "See you later."“再见。”“回头见。”

UK ['leɪ.tər] US [-tˌɚ] adjective [before noun] IN THE FUTURE  在将来   ESSENTIAL  ■happening at a time in the future, or after the time you have mentioned 在将来的某时间、在提及的某时间之后发生
•We could catch a later train.我们可以搭乘晚些时候的火车。

•You can always change your password at a later date.你可以在日后随时变更你的密码。

UK ['leɪ.tər] US [-tˌɚ] adjective [before noun] TOWARDS THE END  晚年；晚期   ESSENTIAL  ■happening towards the end of a period of time or the end of someone's life 接近一段时间的终结或一个人生命的晚期
•He needed round-the-clock care in the later stages of his illness.在患病的晚期他需要昼夜不停的照料。

•During his later years, he lived in London.他的晚年在伦敦渡过。

UK ['leɪ.tər] US [-tˌɚ] adjective [before noun] RECENT  近期的   ESSENTIAL  ■more modern or recent 较现代或近期的
•Later versions of the software are much better.较新版本的软体要好得多。

•Later models included a 2.5 litre engine.近期的型号包括了一个2.5升的引擎。

•I prefer her earlier paintings to her later work.我认为她的早期油画作品比晚期作品好。

UK ['leɪ.tər] US [-tˌɚ] exclamation (also laters) informal ■a way of saying goodbye 道别的一种方式
•Laters, Mike.迈克，再见。





afterward(s), later

这两个副词均有“后来，以后”之意。
afterward(s): 与later的不同之处有两点。1.afterwards指一整段时间之后，一般不分具体时间连用，而later常指一个具体的时间点之后。2.afterward(s)强调事物的先后顺序，而later侧重“迟、推迟”。


adv. 后来；稍后；随后
 - since, subsequently
examples: 英 ['leɪtə(r)] 美 ['leɪtər]
adv.后来；稍后adj.后来的；以后的；接近末期的

(1) She had her baby weaned a year later.(2) I'll speak with her later.(3) I can't pay now, please bill me later.(4) Later information showed that the sub did sink.(5) Arrays will be covered in detail in later chapters.(6) In her later years she gave herself over to writing full-time.
(1) 她在一年后才把孩子的奶断掉。(2) 我要稍后她跟谈。(3) 我现在不能付款，请以后开帐单给我。(4) 后来的情报显示潜艇确实被击沉。(5) 数组问题将在以后的章节里详细讨论。(6) 她晚年专事写作。
[sound:youdao-4d35da07-1db8e78a-e1f02cd4-d96dbe5d-e36fc3f1.mp3]

translation:
adj. 拉丁语的；拉丁人的
n. 拉丁语；拉丁人

分布：拉丁语(38%)，拉丁语的(22%)，拉丁语系国家的(18%)，拉丁人(13%)，拉丁人的(9%)


→来自拉丁语Latinus,即Latium，古罗马地名，词源同latitude,展开，宽度。即Latium人的语言，拉丁语。
a.拉丁的,拉丁文的n.拉丁语He is studying Latin.他在学习拉丁语.



US ['lætˌ-] noun uncountable ■the language used by ancient Romans and as the language of educated people in many European countries in the past 拉丁语
UK ['læt.ɪn] US ['lætˌ-] adjective ■written in Latin 用拉丁语写的
•a Latin poem拉丁语诗歌
■relating to (people or things in) countries which use a language which developed from Latin 拉丁语系国家的；拉丁语系民族的；拉丁人的
•his Latin good looks他那拉丁人特有的英俊相貌
examples: 英 ['lætɪn] 美 ['lætn]
n.拉丁语；拉丁人adj.拉丁语的；拉丁人的；拉丁语系国家的

(1) Many languages have Latin as their base.(2) I can't get this Latin grammar into my head.(3) The reign of the Latin mind was now drawing to an end.(4) Very few students learn Latin now.(5) There are many words of Latin origin.(6) The reign of the Latin mind was now drawing to an end.
(1) 许多语言都以拉丁语为基础。(2) 我理解不了这条拉丁语语法规则。(3) 拉丁人思想的统治现在即将结束。(4) 现在学拉丁语的学生少得很。(5) 有许多源自拉丁语的词汇。(6) 拉丁人思想的统治现在即将结束。

translation:
adj. 后者的; 末了的; 较后的

分布：后者的(71%)，后面的(29%)


→来自late的比较级形式。
a.后者的;后一半的,接近终了的n.后者One of my relatives, a late translator, translated a book relating to public relations.我的一位亲戚,一个已故翻译,翻译了一本有关公共关系的书.



US ['lætˌ.ɚ] adjective [before noun]  IMPROVER  ■near or towards the end of something 后半程的，靠后的，末尾的
•Building of the new library should begin in the latter part of next year.新图书馆的建设应该在明年下半年开工。

•In the latter stages of the fight he began to tire.到那场拳击赛的后半段他开始支援不住了。

UK ['læt.ər] US ['lætˌ.ɚ] noun only singular the latter ■the second of two people, things or groups previously mentioned （提及的两者中的）后者
•She offered me more money or a car and I chose the latter.她提出给我更多的钱或者一辆汽车，我选择了后者。
 Compare the former not standard■the last of more than two people, things or groups previously mentioned （已提及的两个以上的人、事物或群体中的）最后一个



adj. 后者的；近来的；后面的；较后的
 - back, rear
examples: 英 ['lætə(r)] 美 ['lætər]
adj.后者的；后面的

(1) I prefer the former design to the latter.(2) One can travel there by ship or plane. Most people choose the latter.(3) The latter point is the most important.(4) In the latter years of his life he lived alone and never welcomed visitors.
(1) 比起后者的设计方案,我更喜欢前者的。(2) 乘船或乘飞机都可以到那,人们多选择后者。(3) 后面提及的那一点是最重要的。(4) 他晚年独居，从不欢迎来访者。
[sound:youdao-24eba1bb-6533f254-130c5add-08bea419-c0d99b95.mp3]

translation:
vi. 笑; 发笑; 嘲笑; （特别表示因成功而）处于有利地位
vt. 以笑表示，以笑感动[影响]
n. 笑; 笑声; 引人发笑的事或人; 笑料

时态：laughed, laughing, laughs
分布：笑(77%)，笑声(8%)，嘲笑(7%)，发笑(7%)，笑料(1%)


→来自kleg,笑声，拟声词。
v.笑;(on)讥笑n.笑,笑声We all had a good laugh about it.我们都为这事大笑了一阵.



US [læf] verb intransitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to smile while making sounds with your voice that show you think something is funny or you are happy （出声地）笑，大笑
•They laughed at her jokes.听了她讲的笑话他们都笑了。

•I couldn't stop laughing.我情不自禁地笑个不停。

•I said he'd have to give a talk and he laughed nervously.我告诉他说他必须发言，他听后紧张地笑了起来。

•She's so funny - she really makes me laugh.她太有意思了——真让我笑死了。

•It's very rare that a book is so good you actually laugh out loud.一本能让你笑出声来的好书真是不多见。

•It was so funny, I burst out laughing (= laughed suddenly and loudly).太有意思了，我放声笑了出来。

•I laughed till  I  cried.我笑得直流眼泪。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive be laughed out of court ■to be considered as too silly or impossible to take seriously, especially in a court of law （尤指在法庭上）被一笑置之，不被重视
•The proposal will be laughed out of court.这个建议会被认为荒唐可笑。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive be laughing (also will be laughing) UK informal ■used to tell someone that they should not be worried by a particular situation, because they will get an advantage from it 不必发愁，会好起来的
•If the loan's approved you're laughing.如果这笔贷款批下来，你就不必发愁了。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive be laughing all the way to the bank informal ■to be earning a lot of money easily 轻易发大财，轻松赚大钱
•We'll be laughing all the way to the bank if this deal works out.如果这笔生意能成交，我们一下子就能赚很多钱。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive be laughing on the other side of your face UK (US laugh out of the other side of your mouth) ■used to tell someone that although they are pleased now, they will not be pleased later when things do not happen as they expected or planned 到时候就笑不出来了，得意变失意
•She's pleased with her promotion but she'll be laughing on the other side of her face when she sees the extra work.她很高兴自己能获得晋升，不过等她明白自己要多做不少工作时恐怕就笑不出来了。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive be no laughing matter ■to be very serious 不是开玩笑，不是闹着玩的
•It might seem funny but I tell you what, getting stuck up a tree is no laughing matter.卡在树上看起来可能很好笑，不过我跟你讲，这可不是闹着玩的。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive Don't make me laugh! informal ■said to someone to show that you cannot take their suggestion seriously 别开玩笑了！
•You'll pay? Don't make me laugh!你要付钱？别开玩笑了！

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive He who laughs last , laughs longest / best. saying ■said to emphasize that the person who has control of a situation in the end is most successful, even if other people had seemed originally to have an advantage 谁笑在最后，谁笑得最好。
UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive laugh your head  off (also laugh yourself silly) informal ■to laugh a lot, loudly 大笑不止，狂笑不已
•You laughed your head off when I fell!我摔跤了，你却笑个没完！

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive laugh in sb's face ■to make it obvious to someone that you do not respect them 当（某人）的面嘲笑
•They'd laugh in your face if you suggested me for the post.如果你提议让我担任这个职位，他们准会当面嘲笑你。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive laugh like a drain UK informal ■to laugh a lot, very loudly 狂笑，爆笑
UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive laugh up your sleeve ■to secretly find something funny 窃笑，暗自感到好笑
•They're very polite in your presence, but you get the feeling they're laughing up their sleeves.当着你的面他们都很有礼貌，但你能感觉到他们在暗自发笑。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive you've got to laugh (also you have to laugh) informal ■said when you can see something funny in a difficult situation 还是值得一笑，还有可笑之处
UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   laugh at sb/sth  ADVANCED  ■to show that you think someone or something is stupid 取笑，笑话
•I can't go into work looking like this - everyone will laugh at me.我不能这个样子去工作——大家会取笑我的。
■to treat someone or something as if they are not important or do not deserve serious attention 嘲笑，蔑视
•If you say that, people will just laugh at you.如果你那样说，人们就会看不起你。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] laugh sth off ■to make yourself laugh about something unpleasant in order to make it seem less important or serious 对…一笑置之
•She tried to laugh off their remarks, but I could see she was hurt.她试图对他们的话一笑置之，但我看得出她的内心还是受到了伤害。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■the act or sound of laughing 笑；笑声
•a loud/nervous laugh放声大笑／神经质的笑

•I was embarrassed at the time, but I had a good laugh about it later.那时我很尴尬，但过后却觉得非常可笑。
■informal ■an enjoyable or funny activity 令人愉快的活动，好玩的活动
•"How was the party?" "Oh, it was a laugh."“派对办得怎么样？”“哦，相当好玩。”
■mainly UK informal ■someone who is funny 好玩的人，有趣的人
•You'd like Sharon - she's a good laugh.你会喜欢莎伦的——她这个人很风趣。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] noun countable for a laugh informal ■If you do something for a laugh, you do it for enjoyment 取乐，开玩笑
•Just for a laugh, I pretended that I'd forgotten it was his birthday.我假装忘了那天是他的生日，只是想开个玩笑。

UK [lɑ:f] US [læf] noun countable You're having a laugh. UK informal ■used to show that you think that what someone has just said is not reasonable or fair 你在开玩笑
•£500 to cut down a tree - you're having a laugh, mate!500英镑砍一棵树——老兄，你简直是在开玩笑！





giggle, laugh, chuckle, roar, sneer, beam, jeer, grin

这组词都有“笑”的意思，其区别是：
giggle: v.咯咯地笑，痴笑，傻笑，多指女人和孩子由于紧张、被逗乐、尴尬时所发出的笑声。
 • The schoolgirls giggled when the famous football player walkedsintostheir classroom.   当这个著名的足球运动员走进教室时，女生们都咯咯地笑起来。
laugh: v.笑，大笑，用于一般的笑或出声的大笑。
chuckle: v. (书面语)吃吃的笑，抿嘴笑，轻声笑，多指因得意或领会到某事中的趣味而暗自发笑。
 • She does not laugh out loud; she only chuckles.   她没有笑出声来，只是抿嘴而笑。
roar: v.怒吼，咆哮，引申为放声大笑，哄堂大笑。
 • He roared when he heard the joke.   听完这个笑话，他哈哈大笑。
sneer: v.冷笑，嘲笑，指以语言、表情、和声调表示轻蔑或嘲弄。
 • He sneered at the offer and said it was two low.   他对报价嗤之以鼻，说它太低了。
beam: v.本义指照耀，放光，引申为"微笑"，是正式用语，指面带喜悦或笑容，暗示对他人的友好或内心的满足。
 • She beamed with happiness.   她高兴得眉开眼笑。
jeer: v.讥笑，嘲笑，其同义词是mock。
 • The crowd jeered when the boxer was knocked down.   当那个拳手被人打倒时，人群开始嘲笑他。
grin: v.露齿而笑，指人因高兴、满足、轻蔑等咧开嘴露齿地笑。
 • He grinned at his mother.   他冲他的妈妈咧嘴一笑。



laugh, smile, siggle, grin, beam, sneer

这些动词均含“笑”之意。
laugh: 最常用词，指因喜悦、愉快或轻视而出声的笑或大笑。
smile: 指面露微笑，侧重于无声。
siggle: 指发出咯咯的笑声，较多地用于女人或孩子。
grin: 指露齿而笑。
beam: 书面用词，指人因心情舒畅而发出的笑，即喜形于色地笑。
sneer: 指冷笑、嘲笑。


n. 笑；引人发笑的事或人
 - risus
examples: 英 [lɑːf] 美 [læf]
v.发笑；笑；嘲笑n.笑声；笑；笑料

(1) He could tell she was in a bad mood, and tried to laugh her out of it.(2) You have to laugh and find humor every day.(3) You should not laugh at the handicapped.(4) She knew the truth all along and was laughing up her sleeve at us.(5) The captain's cheerful laugh dispelled our fears.(6) Her laugh was as grateful to him as a summer wind.(7) He told me the news with a laugh.(8) What a laugh to say that!
(1) 他看出她心情不好，想逗她笑好让她不再想烦恼的事。(2) 每天都要笑，每天都要找到幽默。(3) 你们不应该嘲笑残疾人。(4) 她早就知道真相，却一直在暗中笑话我们。(5) 船长愉快的笑声消除了我们的恐惧。(6) 她的笑声对于他好象夏天的风一样令人愉快。(7) 他笑着告诉我这个消息。(8) "真可笑,竟说出这种话来!"
[sound:youdao-a7630ddc-1d68bbb9-0de96ef6-2a25718e-8e768dfd.mp3]

translation:
vt. 发射; [计算机]开始（应用程序）; 发动; 开展（活动、计划等）
vi. 投入; 着手进行; 热衷于…
n. 投掷; 大船上的小艇; 大型敞篷摩托艇

时态：launched, launching, launches
分布：发射(87%)，发起(12%)，产品推介(1%)


→来自lance,长矛，原指掷出长矛，引申词义发射，发动。
v.发射;使(船)下水,发动,开展n.发射,下水Uncle and aunt launched a laundry with the blunt hunter.伯伯和伯母与直率的猎人创办了一家洗衣店.



US [lɑ:ntʃ] noun countable EVENT  事件   ADVANCED  ■an event to celebrate or introduce something new 启动仪式，发布会，发表会
•How much champagne will we need for the launch?这次发表会我们需要多少香槟？

•Illness prevented her attending the launch party for her latest novel.她因病无法出席为她新近推出的小说举办的庆祝派对。

UK [lɔ:ntʃ] US [lɑ:ntʃ] noun countable LEAVE LAND  离开陆地   ADVANCED  ■when a ship is sent to see, or a rocket into space, for the first time 下水（船首次出航）；发射（火箭首次升空）
•The launch of the space shuttle was delayed for 24 hours because of bad weather.因天气情况不佳，太空船的发射延迟了24个小时。

UK [lɔ:ntʃ] US [lɑ:ntʃ] noun countable BOAT  船  ■a boat which has an engine and carries passengers for short distances, especially on a lake or a river, or from the land to a larger boat （尤指河或湖上的）汽艇，游艇，摩托艇
UK [lɔ:ntʃ] US [lɑ:ntʃ] verb BEGIN  开始   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to begin something such as a plan or introduce something new such as a product 启动，推出，发起
•The scheme was launched a year ago.这项计划是一年前开始实施的。

•The airline will launch its new transatlantic service next month.这家航空公司下个月将开辟一条新的跨越大西洋的航线。

•A devastating attack was launched on the rebel stronghold.向叛军堡垒发起了猛烈的进攻。

•[+ adv/prep] UK After working for the company for several years she decided to launch out on her own and set up in business.在该公司工作数年后，她决定在商界自立门户。

UK [lɔ:ntʃ] US [lɑ:ntʃ] verb SEND  发送   ADVANCED  transitive ■to send something out, such as a new ship into water or a rocket into space 使（新船）下水；发射（火箭）
•A spokesman for the dockyard said they hoped to launch the first submarine within two years.船厂发言人说他们希望在两年内让第一艘潜艇下水。

•to launch a missile发射导弹
launch yourself mainly UK ■to jump with great force 猛跳，猛地一跃，猛扑
•The defender launched himself at the attacking player, bringing him to the ground.防守队员猛地扑向进攻者，把他摔倒在地。

UK [lɔ:ntʃ] US [lɑ:ntʃ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   launch into sth ■to start saying something or criticizing something with a lot of energy or anger 发起，开始（评说、批评等）
•He launched into a verbal attack on her handling of the finances.他对她的财务管理方式进行了一番抨击。




vt. [航] 发射（导弹、火箭等）；发起，发动；使…下水
 - release, send, project, drive, let go
vi. 开始；下水；起飞
 - proceed, start in
n. [航] 发射；发行，投放市场；下水；汽艇
 - emission, shot, sending, projection, loose
examples: 英 [lɔːntʃ] 美 [lɔːntʃ]
v.发起；推出（新产品）；发射；使(船)下水n.发射；产品推介

(1) We were going to launch a counterattack.(2) The company researched the market demand and decided to launch their new product.(3) The people all over the country exulted in the success in launching a new satellite.(4) The oil tanker was launched last year.(5) We have got good media coverage for the launch of the new model.
(1) 我们准备发起反攻。(2) 这家公司调查了市场需求，决定推出新产品。(3) 全国人民为成功地发射了一颗新的人造卫星而欢欣鼓舞。(4) 那艘油轮去年下水了。(5) 传播媒介对我们的新型产品投放市场作了有利的报导。
[sound:youdao-588a22ad-0e2041fc-bc01f21c-3c4d45f8-cf44de9b.mp3]

translation:

洗衣房(launder洗衣,浆洗)[-ry表名词,通常放在一个完整的单词后面1.表示"状态,性质"2.表示"行业,学科"3.表示集合名词4.表示"场地"]

translation:
n. 法; 法学; 规律; 法制
vt. & vi. [口语、方言]诉诸法律，对…起诉，控告
vt. 控告; 对…起诉

分布：法律(89%)，法规(5%)，起诉(3%)，打官司(2%)，准则(1%)


→来自legh,放置，词源同lie,lay.引申词义放置的标杆，准绳，法规，法律等。词义演变比较doom,statute。
n.法律,法规,法学,规律,定律The enforced law reinforced that forced divorce is forbidden.实施的法律强化了禁止强迫离婚.



US [lɑ:] noun RULE  规定   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■a rule, usually made by a government, that is used to order the way in which a society behaves, or the whole system of such rules 法，法律；法律制度，法律体系
•There are laws against drinking in the street.有法律禁止在街上喝酒。

•The laws governing the possession of firearms are being reviewed.关于持有武器的法律正在审议中。

•They led the fight to impose laws on smoking.他们带头争取对吸烟行为进行法律约束。

•They have to provide a contract by law.他们必须依法提供合同。

•She's going to study law at university.她打算上大学学法律。

•[or+ -ing verb + to infinitive] Many doctors want to see a law banning / to ban all tobacco advertising.许多医生都希望能有法律禁止香烟广告。
⇒ See also bylaw;lawsuit;lawyerthe law  ESSENTIAL  only singular ■the system of rules of a particular country （某国的）法，法律，法律体系
•What does the law say about having alcohol in the blood while driving?关于驾车时血液中含有酒精法律是如何规定的？

•Of course robbery is against the law!抢劫当然是违法的！

•The judge ruled that the directors had knowingly broken the law.法官判定董事们知法犯法。

•You can't take that course of action and remain within the law.如果那样做就会触犯法律。
only singular informal ■the police 警方
•The law was/were out in force at the demonstration.警方派出大队人马在游行现场进行戒备。
go to law ■When someone goes to law about something, they ask a court to decide if it was done legally. 打官司，将…诉诸法律
UK [lɔ:] US [lɑ:] noun PRINCIPLE  原则  countable ■a general rule which states what always happens when the same conditions exist 规律，定律，法则
•Newton's laws of motion牛顿运动定律

•the laws of nature/physics自然规律／物理定律

•humorous The first law of (= the most important principle in) politics is - if you're going to lie, don't get found out!政界的首要原则是——如果你打算说谎，就不要让人发现！
⇒ See also Murphy's law;Parkinson's law
UK [lɔ:] US [lɑ:] noun be a law unto yourself disapproving ■to behave in a way which is independent and does not follow the usual rules for a situation 自行其是，我行我素
•Charlie, of course, never fills in the record forms but then he's a law unto himself.查理当然从不填写登记表，他总是自行其是。

UK [lɔ:] US [lɑ:] noun the law of averages ■the belief that if something happens often then it will also happen regularly 平均律
UK [lɔ:] US [lɑ:] noun the law of the jungle ■the idea that people who care only about themselves will be most likely to succeed in a society or organization 丛林法则，弱肉强食
•We hope for a world where the rule of law, not the law of the jungle, governs the conduct of nations.我们期盼一个以法律制度而不是丛林法则来规范各国行为的世界。

UK [lɔ:] US [lɑ:] noun take the law into your own hands ■to do something illegal and often violent in order to punish someone because you know the law will not punish that person 不透过法律自行惩罚，私自治罪
•One day, after years of violent abuse from her husband, she took the law into her own hands.在经受了多年虐待之后，她终于有一天私自报复了她的丈夫。

UK [lɔ:] US [lɑ:] noun There's one law for the rich and another for the poor. saying ■said when a rich person has not been punished for something that a poor person would be punished for 法律面前贫富不平等。




law, rule, regulation, code, act, constitution

这组词都有“法同，法规”的意思，其区别是：
law: 普通用词，泛指由最高当局所制订、立法机构所通过的任何成文或不成文的法规或条例。
rule: 通常指机关、团体的规章、条例或比赛规则；也指对人行为、方法等所作的规定，还可指习俗所承认的规定。
regulation: 普通用词，指用于管理、指导或控制某系统或组织的规则、规定或原则等。
code: 指某一阶层或社会所遵守的一整套法典、法规或法则；也可指与某一特殊活动或主题有关的规则。
act: 指经立法机构通过并由行政管理签署的法案。
constitution: 指治理国家或国家在处理内外政务时所遵循的基本法律和原则；也指规章规则的汇集。



law, principle, theorem, fundamental

这组词都有“原理、原则”的意思，其区别是：
law: 指一直公认的。陈述各种现象的条理或关系的公理或定理等。
principle: 普通用词，含义广。指作判断的基础或行动的普通准则；也指自然科学的规律。
theorem: 多指经过推理或演算能得到证明的原理、定理或定律。
fundamental: 通常指原理、原则。



law, principle, rule, regulation

law: 指具体的法律，法规，法令
principle: 原理，原则，用作复数是指行为的准则，规范
rule: 规则，规章，惯常的做法，习惯
regulation: 通常用作复数，法规，条例


n. [法] 法律；规律；法治；法学；诉讼；司法界
 - legislation, litigation, suit, lawsuit
vi. 起诉；控告
 - take legal action, go to court
vt. 控告；对…起诉
 - sue for, bring charge against
examples: 英 [lɔː] 美 [lɔː]
n.法律；法规；准则；起诉v.起诉；打官司

(1) The law forbids stealing.(2) Those who break the law are subjected to justice.(3) The new law has received the royal assent.(4) The least possible sin is the law of man.(5) We go to law to try to regain our property.
(1) 法律禁止盗窃。(2) 违法者要受到法制律裁。(3) 新的法规已得到国王的批准。(4) 尽量少犯错误，这是人的准则；(5) 我们起诉极力收回我们的财产。
[sound:youdao-55f2868d-63170ae4-4eb1aee9-b062de00-bf2f8808.mp3]

translation:
n. 草地，草坪; 上等细麻布

分布：草坪(72%)，草地(28%)


→来自古英语laune,词源同land,荒野，土地。后该词用来指荒野，杂草地，现指草坪，草地。
n.草地,草坪At the dawn on the lawn the yawning drowned man began to frown.拂晓时在草坪上,打呵欠的溺水者开始皱眉头.



US [lɑ:n] noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■an area of grass, especially near to a house or in a park, which is cut regularly to keep it short （尤指房屋附近或公园的）草地，草坪
•Will you mow the lawn at the weekend?周末你修剪一下草坪好吗？





pasture, lawn, meadow

这组词都有“草地”的意思，其区别是：
pasture: 通常指放牧用的草地或牧草。
lawn: 多指公园、庭院中经常加以修剪的草坪。
meadow: 指为牲畜提供食用草，可以贮备干草的牧草地；也指野外的低草地。


n. [建] 草地；草坪
 - grass, meadow
examples: 英 [lɔːn] 美 [lɔːn]
n.草坪；草地
(1) My mother asked me to mow the lawn.(2) Let's have tea on the lawn.(3) Moles dug tunnels under the lawn.(4) The reception was held in a pavilion on the lawn.
(1) 妈妈让我去剪草坪。(2) 我们到草坪上去喝茶吧。(3) 鼹鼠在草地下面打洞。(4) 招待会在草地中的亭子里举行。

translation:
n. 律师，法学家

分布：律师(100%)


→law,法律，-yer,人，来自-ier的变体，在w后变成y.
n.律师The lawyer's son-in-law likes hawk's claws and jaws.律师的女婿喜欢鹰爪和下颌.



US ['lɑ:.jɚ] (US also attorney) noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■someone whose job is to give advice to people about the law and speak for them in court 律师
•I want to see my lawyer before I say anything.我开口前要见律师。

UK ['lɔɪ.ər] US ['lɑ:.jɚ] (US also attorney) noun countable   Common Learner Errors   lawyer, solicitor, barrister  and  attorneyIn Britain, lawyers are divided into two types, solicitors and barristers. Solicitors give you advice on legal subjects and discuss your case with you. They can also represent you and argue your case in the lower courts. Barristers give specialist legal advice and can represent you in both higher and lower courts. In America, there is only one type of lawyer, who is sometimes called an attorney.




advocate, attorney, counsel, lawyer

这组词都有“律师”的意思，其区别是：
advocate: 专指以罗马法律的基本法制的一些国家的(如苏格兰等)和一些特别法庭的律师；也可指出庭辩护的律师。
attorney: 主要用于美国，指代理当事人处理遗嘱检验等法律事务的律师，有时可与lawyer通用，泛指辩护律师。
counsel: 指单独或集体为当事人提供咨询或出庭处理案件的法律顾问或律师。
lawyer: 普通用词，指精通法律规则并有权以法律代理人或顾问身份在法庭上执行法律或为委托人服务的人。


n. [法] 律师；法学家
 - advocate, lawer
examples: 英 ['lɔːjə(r)] 美 ['lɔːjər]
n.律师

(1) His lawyer decided to take an appeal to a higher court.(2) Nothing can weaken his resolve to become a lawyer.(3) A good lawyer can always find a loophole.(4) The lawyer explained the new law to us.(5) She is easily the best lawyer in the city.(6) He is dreaming of becoming a lawyer.
(1) 他的律师决定向高一级法上院诉。(2) 什么也动摇不了他要当律师的决心。(3) 精明的律师总能找到漏洞。(4) 律师向我们解释了新法律。(5) 她无疑是本市最好的律师。(6) 他梦想着成为律师。

translation:
vt. 放置; 铺放; 涂，敷; 产卵
adj. 世俗的; 外行的; 没有经验的
n. 叙事诗; 性伙伴

时态：laid, laying, lays
分布：躺下(30%)，产卵(16%)，外行的(12%)，位置(8%)，打赌(8%)，放置(7%)，世俗的(6%)，地形(4%)，交媾(4%)，设计(3%)，使平静(2%)


→来自legh,躺，放置，词源同lie,lair,beleaguer.语法上为lie的宾格动词形式。lay 非神职的，世俗的，外行的
v.放,搁;下(蛋);铺设,敷设;设置,布置Lay a layer of clay on the displayed layout before the relay race.接力赛之前在展示的陈设上铺一层黏土.



verb (laid, laid)PUT DOWN  放下   ESSENTIAL  transitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to put something in especially a flat or horizontal position, usually carefully or for a particular purpose 放置，安放，平放
•She laid the baby on the bed.她把婴儿放在了床上。

•He laid the tray down on the table.他把托盘放在桌子上。

•She laid aside her book and went to answer the phone.她把书放在一边去接电话。

•We're having a new carpet laid in the hall next week.我们准备下周给大厅铺新地毯。

•The plan is to lay (= build) the foundations for the new apartments in October.按照计划新公寓将于十月打地基。
transitive ■to prepare a plan or a method of doing something 计划，研究（方法）
•Even the best laid plans go wrong sometimes.即使最周密的计划有时也会出错。
  Common Learner Errors   lay or lie?Warning:  do not confuse these two verbs!To talk about being in or moving into a horizontal position or being in a particular place, position, or direction, don't use the verb 'to lay', use the verb to lie.In the present tense, don't say 'lay' or 'lays', say lie  or lies :When I'm on holiday I lie on the beach all day and read.In the -ing form, don't say 'laying', say lying :He always leaves his clothes lying on the floor where he took them off.Remember that the past simple of 'lie' is lay , not 'laid':I lay down and went to sleep.
[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)LIE  躺  past simple of■lie (POSITION) 
[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)PRODUCE EGGS  产卵  intransitive or transitive ■(of an animal or bird) to produce eggs from out of the body 产（卵）；产（蛋）
•Thousands of turtles drag themselves onto the beach and lay their eggs in the sand.成千上万只海龟爬上海滩在沙里产卵。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)HAVE SEX  性交  transitive slang ■to have sex with someone 与（某人）发生性关系，与（某人）性交
•So did you get laid (= find someone to have sex with) ?你和人发生性关系了吗？

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)RISK MONEY  赌钱  transitive ■to risk something, usually money, on the result of an event 押（赌注），为…打赌，对…下注
•She won't get the job - I'd lay money on it!她得不到那份工作——我敢打赌！

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)EXPRESS  表达  transitive ■to express a claim , legal statement, etc. in a serious or official way 声称，声明
•She can't accept she made a mistake and now she's trying to lay the blame on (= accuse) her assistant.她无法接受自己犯错误的事实，于是想把责任推到助手的头上。

•specialized Do you understand the seriousness of the charge (= legal accusation) which has been laid against you?你知道对你的这项指控有多严重吗？
lay claim to sth ■to say that you own something 声称…归其所有
•Two companies have laid claim to the design.两家公司都声称自己拥有此项设计的所有权。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay sth at sb's door mainly UK ■to blame someone for something 将…归咎于（某人）
•Blame for the accident has been laid at the government's door.人们认为发生此次事故的责任在政府。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay sb low ■to cause someone to be unable to do what they usually do 使（某人）病倒，使（某人）卧床不起
•A kidney infection laid her low for a couple of months.肾部受感染，让她病了好几个月。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay sth on the line ■to risk harm to something 使…受到危害，使…处于危险中
•I'd be laying my career/life on the line by giving you that information.向你透露那个消息会毁了我的前途／要了我的命。
 informal ■to say very clearly that something is the case 把…说清楚，明白无误地说出，明确说明
•You're just going to have to lay it on the line and tell her that her work's not good enough.你就要把这件事摆到枱面上，明白无误地跟她讲她的工作没做好。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay yourself open to attack/criticism/ridicule, etc. ■to make it easy for people to attack/criticise/ridicule you 给人留下攻击／批评／取笑等的把柄
•She lays herself open to criticism with such unashamedly extreme views.她大言不惭地提出如此极端的观点，给人留下了批评的把柄。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay sb to rest ■to bury a dead person 安葬（某人），埋葬（某人）
•She was laid to rest next to her husband.她被安葬在丈夫旁边。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay sth to rest ■to end a worry or fear 打消，消除（顾虑或恐惧）
•I hope what he said has laid your fears to rest.我希望他说的这些能消除你的恐惧。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay sth to waste (also lay waste) ■to completely destroy something 完全摧毁，彻底捣毁
•The bomb laid the city centre to waste.原子弹将市中心夷为平地。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay a finger on sb ■to harm someone even slightly 动（某人）一个手指头，动（某人）一根毫毛
•Don't you dare lay a finger on me.看你敢动我一根手指头。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay a hand on sb ■to harm someone 对（某人）动手，伤害（某人）
•I never laid a hand on her!我从未伤害过她！

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay bare sth ■to make something known 公开，公布
•It's been promoted as the biography that lays bare the truth behind the legend.它被宣传成是一部揭开传奇背后真相的自传。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay down your life for sth ■to die for something you believe in strongly 为…而献身，为…贡献出自己的生命
•Today we remember those who laid down their lives for their country.今天我们在此纪念那些为国捐躯的人。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay it on a bit thick (also lay it on with a trowel) informal ■to praise someone too much 过分夸奖，过分赞誉
•She went on and on about how she admired his work - laid it on a bit thick, if you ask me.她一直不停地在说对他的工作有多么钦佩——要我说有点过分了。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay the basis/foundations for sth ■to prepare for or start an activity or task 为…打基础；开创
•The initial negotiations are seen as laying the basis for more detailed talks.初期磋商被视作为进一步会谈做准备。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay the ghost of sth (to rest) ■to finally stop being worried or upset about something that has worried or upset you for a long time 终于摆脱…的困扰，终于走出…的阴影
•With one stunning performance, Chelsea have laid to rest the ghost of their humiliating defeat at Old Trafford last season.切尔西队以其出色的表现终于走出了上赛季在老特拉福德惨败的阴影。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)lay up trouble for yourself ■to do something that will cause you trouble in the future 埋下祸根，留下隐患
•You're laying up trouble for yourself if you ignore health problems now.如果现在不重视健康，就会为将来留下隐患。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] lay sth aside STOP  ■to stop doing or thinking about something, usually for a short period of time （通常指暂时）放下，停下
•He's temporarily laid aside some quite interesting projects to write the script.他已经暂时放下一些非常有意思的企划案去写剧本了。
MONEY  ■to keep something, usually money, for use in the future 存（钱），积蓄
•She's trying to lay something aside (= save some money) for her retirement.她想为退休后的生活存些钱。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] lay sth down WINE  specialized■to store wine for drinking in the future 储存，储藏（酒）WEAPONS  ■If someone lays down their weapons, they stop fighting 放下武器，停止战斗
•They laid down their weapons and surrendered.他们放下武器投降了。

•Mediators have persuaded both sides to lay down their arms.调停者已经说服双方停止战斗。
RULES  ■to officially establish a rule, or to officially state the way in which something should be done 规定，制定（条例）
•This is in line with the policy laid down by the management.这一点符合管理层制定的政策。
lay down the law informal ■to forcefully make known what you think should happen 立规矩；发号施令
•She can't just come into this office and start laying down the law.她不能一进办公室的门就开始发号施令。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] lay sth in ■to get a supply of something because you will probably need it in the future 预备，准备，储备
•We'd better lay in plenty of food in case we're cut off when it snows.我们最好储备充足的食物以防下大雪时供应中断。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)
lay 1	  Phrasal Verbs   lay into sb informal * to attack someone physically or to criticise them in an angry way 痛打（某人）；斥责（某人）
•In the middle of the meeting she suddenly laid into him for no apparent reason.在会上，她突然无缘无故地把他训斥了一顿。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M often passive] lay sb off  ADVANCED  ■to stop employing someone, usually because there is no work for them to do 解雇（某人），解聘（某人）
•Because of falling orders, the company has been forced to lay off several hundred workers.由于订单减少，公司被迫解雇了数百名工人。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   lay off (sth/sb) informal ■to stop using or doing something 停止；停用
•You'd better lay off alcohol for a while.你最好戒酒一段时间。

•Why can't you lay off (= stop criticising or hurting) the kid for once!你为甚么不能少训斥孩子一次？

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] lay sth on PROVIDE  ■to provide something for a group of people 提供，供应，供给
•They lay on free entertainment at the club every day.他们每天在俱乐部安排免费娱乐活动。

•They laid on a wonderful buffet after the wedding.婚礼后他们安排了一顿丰盛的自助餐。
TELL  mainly US slang ■to tell someone something they did not know 告知，通知
•I hate to be the one to lay this on you, but your girlfriend has just left with another guy.我真不愿告诉你，你的女朋友刚才跟另一个家伙走了。

[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] lay sth out ARRANGE  ■to arrange something on a flat surface 排列，摆放，铺开
•Most of Manhattan is laid out in/on a grid pattern with avenues going north-south and streets east-west.在曼哈顿的大部分地区呈网格状排列，东西向和南北向的大街交织在一起。

•We laid the pieces of the dress pattern out on the floor.我们把衣服样品一件一件都摊开在地板上。
SPEND MONEY  informal ■to spend money, especially a large amount （大把）花（钱）
•It's not every day you lay out £2000 on a holiday.花2000英镑去渡假可不是常有的事。
⇒ See also outlay
[leɪ] verb (laid, laid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] lay sb out DEAD BODY  ■to prepare a dead person's body to be buried 装殓（尸体）HIT  informal ■to hit someone so hard that they fall down and become unconscious 打晕（某人），打昏（某人）
•Tyson was laid out for several minutes by a blow to the head.泰森头上挨了一拳，昏迷了好几分钟。

[leɪ] adjective [before noun] NOT TRAINED  未经训练的  ■not trained in or not having a detailed knowledge of a particular subject 未经训练的；外行的；非专业的
•From a lay viewpoint the questionnaire is virtually incomprehensible.从外行的角度看，这份问卷调查简直让人无法理解。
⇒ See also layman
[leɪ] adjective [before noun] CHURCH  教会  ■having a position in an organization, especially a religious one, that is not a full-time job and is not paid （尤指在教会等组织中）兼职的，客串的
•a lay preacher兼职牧师
⇒ See also layman
[leɪ] noun countable slang ■used to describe how good someone is at sex, or how often they have sex 形容某人性能力的好坏和发生性行为的频率
•She's a good lay (= Sex with her is enjoyable).她是个不错的性伴侣。

•She got a reputation as an easy lay (= She slept with a lot of people).她和很多人都睡过，得了个放荡的名声。





lied, lay, lie

lied: lied lying    撒谎
lay: vt laid laid laying   放
lie: vi lay lain lying    躺



put, set, lay, place

这组词都有“放”的意思，其区别是：
put: 普通用词，含义较广泛。指把人或物置于某处，并将其留在该处。
set: 普通用词，指为了某种目的而将人或物放在一定位置上。指物是多指立着放。
lay: 指小心地把人或物平放或横放，侧重动作安稳。
place: 较正式用词，指把某物放在一个正确的位置上，侧重动作的正确。


vt. 躺下；产卵；搁放
 - to lie down
adj. 世俗的；外行的
 - strange, mundane
n. 位置；短诗；花纹方向
 - location, situation, site, slot
vi. 下蛋；打赌
 - stake, make a bet
examples: 英 [leɪ] 美 [leɪ]
lie的过去式.v.放置；躺下；打赌；设计；击倒；产卵；使平静；压平n.地形；位置；叙事短诗；交媾adj.外行的；世俗的

(1) You may lay it on the table.(2) I lay down not so much to sleep as to think.(3) I'll lay odds of three to one that he gets the job.(4) He showed us how to lay out a printed page.(5) Surveyors lay out Wall Street along the line of the stockade.(6) They lay eggs from the beginning of July to the middle of August.(7) He knows the lay of the land here.(8) Lay more emphasis on combating corruption and advocating integrity.(9) A lay figure can be placed in any position, or attitude, and clothed in any costume and thus serves as a model for the drapery.(10) A lay opinion as to the seriousness of the disease.

(1) 你可以把它放在桌子上。(2) 我躺下来与其说是要睡觉，倒不如说是要思考。(3) 我以三比一的赔率打赌，他能得到那份工作。(4) 他告诉我们怎样设计版面。(5) 测量员沿着栅栏设计出墙街。(6) 它们在7月初到8月中这段时间产卵。(7) 他了解这里的地形。(8) 把反腐倡廉放在更加突出的位置上。(9) 人体模型可以放在任何位置，摆成任何姿势，穿上任何服装，作为服装店的模特儿。(10) 关于这种疾病的非专业的意见

n. 层，层次; 膜; [植]压条; 放置者，计划者
vt. 把…分层堆放; 借助压条法; 生根繁殖; 将（头发）剪成不同层次
vi. 形成或分成层次; [植]通过压条法而生根

时态：layered, layering, layers
分布：层(99%)，分层(1%)


→来自lay,放置，引申词义层次，阶层，
n.层,层次;铺设者Lay a layer of clay on the displayed layout before the relay race.接力赛之前在展示的陈设上铺一层黏土.
【记】不认识的同学回家学学Photoshop就ok了。



US [-ɚ] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a level of material, such as a type of rock or gas, which is different from the material above or below it, or a thin sheet of a substance 层；涂层
•the ozone layer臭氧层

•A thick layer of clay lies over the sandstone.沙岩上面有一层厚厚的黏土。

•There was a thin layer of oil on the surface of the water.水面上有一层薄薄的油膜。

•We stripped several layers of paint off the door.我们从门上剥落了好几层漆。

UK ['leɪ.ər] US [-ɚ] verb transitive ■to arrange something in layers 把…按层排列，把…分层放置
•Layer the pasta with slices of tomato.把番茄片分层摆放在义大利粉里。

•potatoes layered with onions马铃薯夹洋葱片




n. 层，阶层；地层
 - thickness, degree, stratum, tier
examples: 英 ['leɪə(r)] 美 ['ler]
n.层vi.分层vt.将某物堆积成层

(1) This layer of rock contains a lot of flint.(2) There is a fine layer of dust on the desk.(3) There are several layers of meaning.(4) The pollution had destroyed ozone layer and caused many changes in weather.(5) Mists layered thick about him.(6) Layer the potatoes and onions in a dish.(7) We layer the crops to make them grow better.
(1) 这一岩层中有大量燧石。(2) 桌子上有一层薄薄的尘土。(3) 有几层不同的含意。(4) 污染破坏了臭氧层，并引起了许多天气变化。(5) 层层雾霭笼罩着他。(6) 把土豆和洋葱分层放在盘子里。(7) 我们对农作物进行压条处理，以利于他们生长。

translation:
n. 布局，安排，设计; 布置图，规划图

分布：布局(77%)，设计(21%)，安排(2%)


→即展开，布局，布置。

noun countable ■the way that something is arranged 布局，布置，排列
