translation:
vi. 变少，减少; 贬低，轻视，看不起
vt. 减少（某事物），缩小

时态：lessened, lessening, lessens
分布：减少(59%)，减轻(41%)


→less,较小，-en,使。引申词义减轻。



verb intransitive or transitive ■If something lessens or is lessened, it becomes less strong 减少，降低，减轻
•A healthy diet can lessen the risk of heart disease.健康饮食能降低患心脏病的危险。





diminish, dwindle, lessen, decrease, reduce

这组词都有“减少，变少”的意思，其区别是：
diminish: 侧重大小数量和重要性的不断减小，强调减小的部分。
dwindle: 与decrease同义，指逐渐减小，但强调变得越来越少终至全无。
lessen: 普通用词，与decrease近义。指数目、程度、价值、实力等的减少。
decrease: 指逐渐地、不断地减少。
reduce: 普通用词，含义广。指数量、程度的降低或减少。


vi. 减少；减轻；变小
 - to cut down, fall off
examples: [扩展] lessen减少lesson课程everyone wants to lessen some lessons
英 ['lesn] 美 ['lesn]
v.减少；减轻

(1) We should be able to lessen the damage to the city here.(2) This medcine can lessen the pain in no time.(3) Regular exercise can help to lessen the pain.(4) Coming back here didn't lessen my confusion and pain.
(1) 在这里我们必须能够减少对这个城市的损坏。(2) 这种药可以立刻减轻痛苦。(3) 经常运动有助于减轻痛感。(4) 回来之后我的困惑和苦恼并没有减轻。
[sound:youdao-58c34cec-6d6ccae3-ceb11e27-c6fe78d9-064c886d.mp3]

translation:
n. 教训，训诫; 功课; 课程，一堂课; [宗]日课
vt. 教训，训斥; 教课; 向…授课

分布：教训(99%)，给 ... 上课(1%)


→来自拉丁语legere,读，讲，词源同lecture,-ss,过去分词后缀。原义为朗诵圣经，经文，后词义通用化。
n.(功)课;[pl.]课程;教训I'm busy unless I'm blessed with less lesson.我很忙,除非我很幸运只有少量功课.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a period of time in which a person is taught about a subject or how to do something （一节）课
•How can we make science lessons more interesting?我们怎样才能把理科课程讲得更有趣一些呢?

•She has never had/taken any acting lessons.她从未上过表演课。

•He gives French lessons.他教法语课。
 IMPROVER  ■an experience which teaches you how to behave better in a similar situation in the future 经验，教训
•There is a lesson for all parents in this tragic accident.所有父母都应该从这起悲剧性事件中吸取教训。

•My parents made me pay back all the money and it was a lesson I never forgot.我父母让我把钱都还了回去，这次教训我永远都不会忘记。

•We can learn important lessons (= gain new understanding) from this disaster.从这次灾难中我们可以汲取重要教训。





course, lesson, lecture, class

这组词都有“课”的意思，其区别是：
course: 指在一段时间内教完或学完的完整的课程。
lesson: 主要指教材中的一课或每次授课的单位时间。
lecture: 指讲课。
class: 从“班级”引申指学生在一起上课，还可表示“(一节)课”。


n. 教训；课
 - lecture, indoctrinization
vt. 教训；上课
 - attend class, have a class
examples: 英 ['lesn] 美 ['lesn]
n.教训；课，功课，课业；榜样，典范vt.教训，告诫，训斥；给 ... 上课

(1) Such a lesson should be treasured in our memories.(2) That accident taught them a lesson.(3) This lesson pertains to marine animals.(4) The first lesson is taken from St John's Gospel.(5) The bitter lesson is branded on his memory.(6) That accident taught them a lesson.(7) Today we'll reverse the usual order of the lesson.(8) Please do not enter while a lesson is in progress.
(1) 这样的宝贵教训应该铭记在心。(2) 那次事故给了他们一个教训。(3) 这一课讲海洋动物。(4) 第一段圣经选自《约翰福音》。(5) 那个惨痛的教训深深铭刻在他记忆中。(6) 那次事故给了他们一个教训。(7) 今天我们将把通常的上课顺序倒过来。(8) 上课中途请勿走进教室。
[sound:youdao-93a24e91-07166b3e-b30e8204-bf6bd8d7-23a8d4a0.mp3]

translation:
conj. 唯恐; 以免; 惟恐; 生怕

分布：以免(78%)，担心(15%)，惟恐(7%)


→来自古英语短语les te,少于某某的情况下，les,即less,te,即that.比较unless,despite.
conj.惟恐,免得Boil the oil soiled by the coil in the toilet lest it spoil.把被盥洗室里的线圈弄脏的油煮开,免得它变质.



[lest] literary conjunction ■in order to prevent any possibility that something will happen 以免，唯恐
•They were afraid to complain about the noise lest they annoyed the neighbours.他们不敢对噪音有任何抱怨，唯恐惹恼了邻居。
examples: 英 [lest] 美 [lest]
conj.惟恐；以免；担心

(1) They spoke in whispers lest they should be heard.(2) He took a flashlight lest it should get dark before he returned.(3) We talked in a low voice lest we should wake the baby up.(4) I was afraid lest the new car should be stolen.
(1) 他们低声说话，唯恐被别人听见。(2) 为了预防回来以前天就黑了，所以他带着手电筒。(3) 我们小声说话以免吵醒婴儿。(4) 我担心新汽车会被偷走。
[sound:youdao-b31e8978-97574ca6-4b60fbcc-c6fa280c-c5352066.mp3]

translation:
允许，任由; 让，随; 假设; 出租

时态：let, letting, lets
分布：让(87%)，出租(6%)，假设(3%)，允许(3%)，阻碍(1%)


→来自le,松开，松手，容许，词源同late,lenient,lassitude.
v.让,允许,听任;设,假设;出租,租给Let him in at once.让他立刻进来.



verb (letting, let, let)ALLOW  允许   ESSENTIAL  [T + infinitive without to] ■to allow something to happen or someone to do something by not doing anything to stop an action or by giving your permission 让；允许；准许
•She wanted to go but her parents wouldn't let her.她想走，但父母不让。

•He decided to let his hair grow long.他决定把头发留起来。

•Let your shoes dry completely before putting them on.让鞋子干透以后再穿。

•I'm letting you stay up late, just this once.我允许你开夜车，但仅此一次。

•Don't let it worry you.不要让它惹你心烦。

•If he needs money, let him (= he should) earn it!如果他需要钱，就让他去赚吧！
 IMPROVER  [T + obj + infinitive without to] [not in past tenses] ■used to show that you accept what is going to happen, although you do not like it 任由
•Let it rain - it won't spoil our afternoon.随它下吧——下雨不会影响我们下午的活动。
  Common Learner Errors   letLet  is followed by a verb in the infinitive without 'to'.Do not say 'let someone to do something', say let someone do something.✗ My parents don't let me to watch television after 9pm.My parents don't let me watch television after 9pm.  Common Learner Errors   let or leave?Warning:  Do not confuse 'let' and 'leave'To talk about not taking someone or something with you when you go, don't say 'let' say leave :✗ People should let their cars at home and go to work by bus.People should leave their cars at home and go to work by bus.
[let] verb (letting, let, let)SUGGEST  建议  let's  ESSENTIAL  ■also formallet us used to express a suggestion or request which includes you and the other person or people （表示建议或请求）让我们
•Let's go out to dinner.我们出去吃晚饭吧。

•Let us consider all the possibilities.让我们来考虑一下各种可能性吧。

•Let's not argue/ UK alsoDon't let's argue.我们别争了。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)RENT  出租  transitive mainly UK (mainly US rent) ■to allow your house or land to be lived in or used by someone else in exchange for a regular payment 租出去，出租
•They are letting their house (out) for the summer.他们准备夏天把房子租出去。

•He's let his flat to a young couple.他把公寓房租给了一对年轻夫妇。

•She has a room to let in her house.她的房子里有一个房间要出租。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let sb be ■to stop criticizing or annoying someone 随（某人）去；不打扰（某人）
[let] verb (letting, let, let)let yourself go informal ■to allow yourself to become less attractive or healthy 放任自流；不修边幅；放纵自己
•It's easy to let yourself go when you've got small kids.有了小孩后很容易就不注意打扮了。
■to relax completely and enjoy yourself 完全放松，尽情享受
•It's a party - let yourself go!这是个派对——尽情地玩吧！

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let sth go/pass ■to not correct or argue with something that a person says or does that is wrong 不理睬，不反驳，不追究
•I know what he said wasn't strictly accurate but I let it pass anyway.我知道他说的并不十分准确，但不管怎样，我没有去追究。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let your hair down old-fashioned informal ■to allow yourself to behave much more freely than usual and enjoy yourself 放开些，尽情享受
•Oh let your hair down for once!尽情地玩一次吧！

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let sb have it slang■to attack someone with words or physically 抨击（某人）；攻击（某人）
[let] verb (letting, let, let)let sb in on a secret ■to allow someone to know something that you have not told anyone else 向（某人）透露秘密
•Shall I let you in on a little secret?要我告诉你一个小秘密吗？

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let sb know  ADVANCED  ■to tell someone something 告知，通知
•Let us know wh en you get there.你到那里后告诉我们一声。

•Let me know if you need any help.如果需要帮助就告诉我。

•Thank you for coming to the interview - we'll let you know (= tell you whether we are going to offer you a job) in the next week.谢谢你来参加面试——下周我们会告诉你结果。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let sth slip ■to tell people about something without intending to 说漏了嘴，无意中泄漏
•He let it slip that he hadn't actually read the report.他无意中透露出他根本就没有看过那个报告。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let go  IMPROVER  ■to stop holding something 放开，松手
•Hold on tight and don't let go!抓紧，别松手！

•Let go of my hand, you're hurting me!放开我的手，你弄痛我了！

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let it all hang out old-fashioned slang ■to behave freely without being shy or feeling worried about what other people will think of you 不拘礼节，自由随意
[let] verb (letting, let, let)let it be known formal ■to make certain that people know something 让大家都知道，到处宣扬
•I let it be known that I was not happy about the decision that had been made.我公开表示我对作出的决定不满意。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let it lie (also let things lie) ■to take no action about something 对…不闻不问，对…置之不理，对…听之任之
•Instead of going to the police they let things lie for a couple of months.他们没去报警，好几个月对此都不闻不问。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let rip/fly informal ■to behave in an angry and emotional way 发怒；失去理智
•She let rip about the state of the kitchen.她对厨房的状况大发雷霆。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let the side down mainly UK informal ■to behave in a way that embarrasses or causes problems for a group of people that you are part of 使自己人难堪；拆自家人的台
[let] verb (letting, let, let)let's face it ■said before stating something that is unpleasant but true 我们面对事实吧
•Let's face it, we're not going to win.我们面对事实吧，我们不会赢的。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)let's see (also let me see/think) ■used when you want to think carefully about something or are trying to remember 让我想想看，让我想一想
•Next Saturday, let's see, that's when we're going to the theatre.下周六，让我想想，那天我们要去看戏。

•The last time I spoke to her was, now let me think, three weeks ago.我上一次和她说话是，让我想想，三个星期以前。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] let sb down  ADVANCED  ■to disappoint someone by failing to do what you agreed to do or were expected to do 辜负（某人），使（某人）失望
•You will be there tomorrow - you won't let me down, will you?明天你会去那里的——你不会让我失望，对吧？

•When I was sent to prison, I really felt I had let my parents down.我入狱的时候真觉得对不起我的父母。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] let sth down CLOTHES  ■If you let down a piece of clothing, you make it longer 把（衣服）放长一些，将（衣服）加长
•My trousers shrank in the wash so I let them down.我的裤子洗过后缩水了，所以我把裤腿放长了。
AIR  UK ■If you let down something filled with air, you cause the air to go out of it 给…放气，放出…中的空气
•Someone let my tyres down while I was at the gym.我在健身房时有人把我的车胎给放了气。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] let sb/sth in  ADVANCED  ■to allow someone or something to enter 允许…进入
•She opened the door and let me in.她打开门让我进去。

•These shoes are starting to let water in.这双鞋子开始进水了。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   let yourself in for sth ■to become involved in a difficult or unpleasant situation without intending to 使自己陷入，使自己卷入■1. Do you realize how much extra work you're letting yourself in for?
let 1	 你意识到你在给自己增加多少额外的工作吗？
[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   let sb in on sth ■to tell someone about something that is secret, or to allow someone to become involved in something which only very few people are involved in 向（某人）公开；允许（某人）参与（秘密的事情）
•Debbie agreed to let me in on her plans.黛比同意让我知道她的计划。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   let sth into sth UK ■to put something into a flat surface so that it does not stick out 镶嵌（把某物嵌入平坦的表面，使之不突出）
•A skylight had been let into the roof.屋顶嵌上了一扇天窗。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] let sb off  ADVANCED  ■to not punish someone who has committed a crime or done something wrong, or to not punish them severely 宽宥（某人）；从轻处罚（某人）
•Instead of a prison sentence they were let off with a fine.他们没有被判刑，只是被罚了款而已。

•You won't be let off so lightly (= you will be punished more severely) the next time.下一次就不会这样轻饶你了。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] let sth off ■to fire a gun or make something such as a bomb or fireworks explode 放（枪）；开（炮）；引爆
•Don't let off fireworks near the house.不要在房子附近放烟火。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   let on informal ■to tell other people about something that you know, especially when it is a secret 透露，泄露（秘密）
•I suspect he knows more this than he's letting on.除了透露出的那些情况外，我怀疑他对这件事还知道更多。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] let sb/sth out  ADVANCED  ■to allow someone or something to leave a place, especially by opening a closed or fastened door 允许…离开，放开，放走
•I heard a voice from the cupboard shouting "Let me out!"我听到橱柜里有人喊：“放我出去！”

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] let sth out ESCAPE  ■to cause something to come out 放出，发出
•He let the air out of the balloon.他把气球里的空气放了出来。

•She let out a scream (= She made this noise).她发出一声尖叫。
CLOTHES  ■to make a piece of clothing wider by removing the sewing from the sides and sewing closer to the edge of the material 把（衣服）放宽
•These trousers are too tight - I'm going to have to let them out.这条裤子太紧了——我准备把它放宽一些。

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   let out US ■When something that people go to, such as school or a show, lets out, it ends and everyone leaves 结束；（学校）放假，放学；（演出）散场
•When does school let out for the summer?学校甚么时候放暑假？

[let] verb (letting, let, let)  Phrasal Verbs   let up informal IMPROVE  ■If bad weather or an unpleasant situation lets up, it stops or improves 改善，好转；停止
•When the rain lets up we'll go for a walk.等雨一停我们就出去散步。
STOP  ■to stop doing something that you have been doing continuously or in a determined way 停止，终止
•Neil spent the entire evening moaning about his job - he just wouldn't let up.尼尔一整晚都在抱怨他的工作——说起来没完没了。

•The police insist that they are not letting up on their campaign against drugs.警方坚称不会停止打击毒品犯罪的行动。

[let] adverb let alone ■used after a negative statement to emphasize how unlikely a situation is because something much more likely has never happened （用于否定句后表示强调）当然不会，更不用说
•Some people never even read a newspaper, let alone a book.有些人从不看报纸，更不用说读书了。

[let] noun SPORT  体育  countable ■(in tennis or similar games) a situation in which the ball touches the net as it crosses it, so that you have to play the point again （网球等运动专案的）发球擦网，发球触网
[let] noun LAW  法律  without let or hindrance specialized ■without being prevented from doing something 无障碍地，自由地
•People will be able to travel from country to country without let or hindrance.人们将能够在各国之间自由往来。

[let] noun RENT  出租  countable UK ■the act of allowing someone to use your house, land, etc. in exchange for regular payments 出租，租赁
•a five-year let on a flat为期五年的公寓租赁





authorize, leave, allow, let, permit

这组词都有“让、允许”的意思，其区别是：
authorize: 语气最强，指权威性的允许与认可。
leave: 侧重不加干涉。
allow: 普通用词，侧重听任、默许或不加阻止。在正式场合可用来表客气的请求。
let: 常用词，用于各种非正式场合，语气最弱，指允许或无力阻止某事，暗示漠不关心或听之任之。
permit: 正式用词，在多数场合可与allow换用，语义最强，指准许某人做某事，含权威或正式的意味。



charter, let, lease, rent, hire

这组词都有“租，租用”的意思，其区别是：
charter: 指承租大型运输工具，如飞机、轮船、大客车以及火车等。
let: 尤指出租房屋或地产等。
lease: 指按照租约租出或租用房屋、土地或其它不动产。
rent: 在英国指较长时间租出或租入房屋、商店或土地；而在美国指长时间或短时期租用各种资产以及日用东西。
hire: 多指短期租用。在英国一般指租用车、船。


vt. 允许，让；出租；假设；妨碍
 - have, say, grant, rent, suppose
vi. 出租；被承包
 - rent, lease out
n. 障碍；出租屋
 - obstacle, bar, dam, stop
examples: 英 [let] 美 [let]
v.让；允许；(用于祈使句表建议、请求、命令)让；假设；出租n.出租；阻碍；(网球等)触网重发

(1) I won't let him get away with that excuse.(2) I don't agree with all you say, but I'll let it go at that.(3) No visitors are let into the committee meetings.(4) Let me have a look at this watch.(5) Let the line AB be equal to the line XY.(6) Let ABC be an angle of ninety degrees .(7) The shop is let on very favourable terms.(8) I asked her if she had any rooms to let.(9) I can't get a let for my house.(10) Please allow the bearer of this passport to pass freely without let or hindrance.(11) If you hit a let,you can serve again.
(1) 我不会让他用那种借口蒙混过去。(2) 我并不完全同意你说的话，但我不再多说了。(3) 委员会会议不允许任何访问者闯入。(4) 把这只表让我看看。(5) 假设ab 线与XY 线相等。(6) 假设ABC为90度的角。(7) 该商店以特惠条件出租。(8) 我问她有没有房间出租。(9) 我的房子租不出去。(10) 请予护照持有人顺利通行。(11) 如果发了擦网球，可以再发一次。
[sound:youdao-349f7f75-3cd36e7f-758a14ea-f858d4b8-11ef190a.mp3]

translation:
n. 信; 证书，许可证; 字母，文字; 字面意义
vt. 用字母标明; 写字母于; 加标题
vi. 写印刷体字母

时态：lettered, lettering, letters
分布：信(90%)，字母(8%)，写下(1%)，印刷(1%)


→来自拉丁语litera,字母，文字，词源同literal.引申词义信件。
n.信,函件;字母,文字It's better to put letters at the inlet and outlet.最好在进口和出口处标上字母.



US ['letˌ.ɚ] noun countable MESSAGE  资讯   ESSENTIAL  ■a written message from one person to another, usually put in an envelope and sent by the post 信，信件
•I got a letter from the bank this morning.今天早晨我收到了一封银行的来函。

UK ['let.ər] US ['letˌ.ɚ] noun countable SYMBOL  符号   ESSENTIAL  ■any of the set of symbols used to write a language, representing a sound in the language 字母
•the letter D字母D
the letter of the law formal ■the exact words of the law and not its more important general meaning 法律的准确字面意义
UK ['let.ər] US ['letˌ.ɚ] noun countable to the letter ■If you obey instructions or rules to the letter, you do exactly what you have been told to do, giving great attention to every detail 一丝不苟地；丝毫不差地
•I followed the instructions to the letter and it still went wrong.我严格按指令行事，但还是出了问题。





message, correspondence, letter, note

这组词都有“信”的意思，其区别是：
message: 指书信、口信、电报等。
correspondence: 集合名词，指全部来往信件。
letter: 最普通用词，泛指一切形式的书信，尤指邮寄的信。
note: 指内容直截了当的短信或便条，正式或非正式均可。



letter, alphabet, script, character

这组词都有“字母”的意思，其区别是：
letter: 指单个的字母。
alphabet: 指整个字母系统或一种语言的字母表，不表单个字母。
script: 指书写或印刷的字母。
character: 通常指汉语的方块字，也指字符。


n. 信； [语] 字母，文字；证书；文学，学问；字面意义
 - literature, knowledge, learning, study, certificate
examples: 英 ['letə(r)] 美 ['letər]
n.信；字母v.写下；印刷n.租赁人

(1) She balled the letter into a wad.(2) I acknowledged her letter at once.(3) The kids are learning to trace the letter.(4) Anger is one letter away from danger.(5) He wrote these words after he had lapped up his letter.(6) While composing a letter on a computer you may interrupt the computer's rest with a short burst of key pounding and then let it return to idleness as you compose the next sentence.(7) The printer has dropped a letter here.(8) I learned about serif and san serif typefaces, about varying the amount of space between different letter combinations, about what makes great typography great.

(1) 她将信揉成一团。(2) 我马上告知收到了她的信。(3) 孩子们学描字母。(4) 生气与危险仅相差一个字母。(5) 他是把信折好以后才又写下了这些话的。(6) 当你在计算机上写信时，随着敲击键盘产生的短脉冲会打断计算机的休息，接着当你写下一句话的时候，它会返回到无所事事的状态。(7) 印刷者在这儿遗漏了一个字母。(8) 我学习写带短截线和不带短截线的印刷字体，根据不同字母组合调整其间距，以及怎样把版式调整得好上加好。
[sound:youdao-2e070dc4-1a8ac4a8-b8368413-f95e2d2e-5e7c5786.mp3]

translation:
n. 水平，水准; 水平线，水平面; 水平仪; [物]电平
adj. 水平的; 同高度的; 平均的; 平稳的
vt. 使同等; 对准; 弄平
vi. 拉平; （用枪等）瞄准（与 at 连用）; 变得平坦; 将（话、批评等）对准目标
vi. 瞄准; 拉平; 变得平坦

时态：levelled, levelling, levels
分布：水平(74%)，平的(13%)，等级(5%)，弄平(2%)，对准(2%)，水平线(2%)，夷平(1%)，数量(1%)


→来自拉丁语libella,平衡，秤，词源同Libra,deliberate.引申词义水平，层级。
n.水平,水准,等级v.弄平,铺平a.水平的Elevate the eleventh level to relevant height.提高第11步到相关的高度.



noun countable HEIGHT  高度   ESSENTIAL  ■the height of something 高度
•The water level in the lake is much higher after heavy rain.暴雨过后这个湖的水位上升了很多。
 ESSENTIAL  ■the amount or number of something 数目，数量
•Inflation is going to rise 2% from its present level.通货膨胀率将比目前上涨2%。

•Chess requires a very high level of concentration.下棋需要注意力高度集中。

•There is some danger of low level (= a continuing small amount of) radiation.存在低剂量辐射的危险。

['lev.əl] noun countable ABILITY  能力   ESSENTIAL  ■someone's ability compared to other people （与他人相比的）能力，水准，级别
•a course for advanced level students面向高级别学生的课程

•Students at this level require a lot of help.处于这种程度的学生需要大量的帮助。

•The exam can be taken at three levels.这种考试分为三个级别。

['lev.əl] noun countable FLOOR  楼层   ADVANCED  ■a floor in a large building 层，楼层
•The library has three levels, with a conference centre at ground level.这个图书馆分三层，在一层有一个会议中心。

•The exhibition is on level three of the building.该展览在大厦的四层。

['lev.əl] noun countable RANK  等级   ADVANCED  ■a position within a system in which people are arranged according to their importance 层次，级别
•These are subjects for discussion at management level.这些是管理层需要讨论的问题。
at local/national level ■relating to a particular area of the country/the whole of the country 在当地／全国
•These sorts of policies are made at local level.这些政策由当地部门制定。

['lev.əl] noun countable be on the level ■to be acting or speaking honestly 言行诚实；真心
•It seems too good to be true. Are you sure this guy's on the level?这似乎好得有些让人不敢相信。你确定这家伙是真心的吗？

['lev.əl] noun countable find your own level ■to find out how much ability you have and find a position which is therefore suitable 找到自己的位置，确定自己的水准
['lev.əl] noun countable on one level...on another level ■something that you say when you are speaking about two opposite ways of thinking about or responding to a situation 一方面…另一方面
•On one level I quite like the attention but on another level, I suppose I find it a bit disturbing.一方面我很喜欢这种关注，但另一方面我又觉得这种关注对我有些干扰。

['lev.əl] adjective AT SAME HEIGHT  在同等高度   ADVANCED  [after verb] ■at the same height 高度相等的，等高的
•The top of the tree is level with his bedroom window.那棵树的树顶和他睡房的窗户处于同一高度。

['lev.əl] adjective FLAT  平的   ADVANCED  ■flat or horizontal 平的，水准的
•Make sure the camera is level before you take the picture.拍照前要保证相机处于水准位置。

•Before I bang the nails in, would you say this picture was level?在我把钉子敲进去之前，请帮我看看这幅画歪了没有？
level spoonful/cupful ■an amount of a liquid or substance which fills a spoon/cup but does not go above the edges, used as a measure in cooking （烹饪时用于计量的）一平勺／杯的量
['lev.əl] adjective EQUAL  相等的  ■having the same value, amount, number of points, etc 相等的；等量的
•The unions are fighting to keep wages level (US usuallyeven)with inflation.工会正在争取工资与通货膨胀率保持同步增长。

•Chiappucci would have to win the next three stages in order to draw  level  with (= reach the same position as) Indurain in the Tour de France.基亚普齐必须在此次环法自行车赛后面的三个赛段中取胜才能赶上因杜拉因。

['lev.əl] adjective CONTROLLED  受控制的  [before noun] ■If you speak in a level voice or give someone a level look, you do it in a calm and controlled way （说话声或目光）平静的，平稳的
•In a level voice, he ordered the soldiers to aim and fire.他语调平静地命令士兵们瞄准射击。

['lev.əl] adjective do your level best ■to try as hard as you can 竭尽全力，全力以赴
•Tickets are hard to come by but I'll do my level best to get you one.票很难弄到，但我会尽全力给你弄一张的。

['lev.əl] adjective level pegging UK ■in an equal position in a competition or game （在竞赛或比赛中）难分伯仲，不分胜负
•Both teams are level pegging.目前两队并驾齐驱。

['lev.əl] adjective a level playing field ■a situation in which everyone has the same chance of succeeding 公平竞争的环境
•If the tax systems are different in each European country, how can industries start on a level playing field?如果欧洲各国的税制不同，那么不同国家的各个行业怎能在均等机会下展开竞争呢？

['lev.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)MAKE FLAT  弄平  ■to make a surface flat 弄平，使平整
•Level the wet cement before it sets.在水泥凝固前把它抹平。

['lev.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)DESTROY  破坏  ■to completely destroy a building or area 将…夷为平地，彻底摧毁
•The bombing levelled the village.那次轰炸已将村庄夷为平地。

['lev.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)  Phrasal Verbs   level sth against/at sb ■to accuse someone in public of doing something wrong 公开谴责（某人），公开指责（某人）
•Criticism has been levelled at senior figures in the industry.该行业的高层人物受到了公开谴责。

•Charges of corruption have been levelled against him.有关腐败的指控纷纷指向了他。

['lev.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)  Phrasal Verbs   level sth at sb ■to aim something such as a weapon at someone 用…瞄准（某人）
•She picked up the gun and levelled it at me.她拿起枪用枪口指着我。

['lev.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)  Phrasal Verbs   level off ■If a rate or amount levels off, it stops rising or falling and stays at the same level 保持稳定（不再波动）
•House prices now seem to be levelling off after the steep rises of the last few years.房价经过这几年的窜升后目前似乎已趋于稳定。

•Unemployment rose to 10% and then levelled off.失业率在上升至10%后一直处于稳定状态。

['lev.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)  Phrasal Verbs   level off/out ■If an aircraft levels off/out, it starts to travel horizontally rather than going up or down 水准飞行
•The jet levelled off at 10, 000 feet.飞机在一万英尺的高度水准飞行。

['lev.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)  Phrasal Verbs   level with sb informal ■to tell someone the truth about something 告知（某人）真相，对（某人）说真话
•I'll level with you - the salary's not particularly good, and there's little chance of promotion.我实话跟你说——工资并不太高，也没有多少晋升的机会。





smooth, level, flat, even

这组词都有“平的，平坦的”的意思，其区别是：
smooth: 侧重指表面十分平滑，无任何粗糙的感觉。引申作圆滑解。
level: 强调没有高低之处，且在同一水平面，可引申指才能相等或与相邻某物平行。
flat: 指光滑平整的表面，但不一定是水平的。
even: 通常指平面上的各点或一条直线的各点处在同一平面或直线上。


n. 水平；标准；水平面
 - criterion, standard, norms, prototype
adj. 水平的；平坦的；同高的
 - horizontal, flat, even
vi. 瞄准；拉平；变得平坦
 - aim for, take aim at
vt. 使同等；对准；弄平
 - platten
examples: 英 ['levl] 美 ['levl]
n.数量；等级；水平；水平线adj.平的；等高的v.弄平；夷平；对准adv.水平地

(1) Levels of unemployment vary from region to region.(2) We must increase production levels.(3) The top of this mountain is three kilometers above the sea level.(4) A football field should be level.(5) The two picture is not quite level that one is higher than the other.(6) We need a mechanical digger to level the ground.(7) The bombing raid practically leveled the town.(8) The hostage had a rifle levelled at his head.
(1) 失业情形各地不同.(2) 我们必须提高生产水平。(3) 这座山的山顶海拔三千米高。(4) 足球场地应该平坦。(5) 这两幅画挂得不一般高, 这幅比那幅高。(6) 我们需要一台挖掘机来平整土地。(7) 空袭几乎把这座城镇夷为平地。(8) 一枝步枪瞄准着人质的头。
[sound:youdao-54d56022-5a5a9b67-7f1b49ff-27e9f88a-2c4fde1a.mp3]

translation:
n. 杠杆; 操作杆; 工具
vt. 用杠杆撬动

时态：levered, levering, levers
分布：杠杆(84%)，控制杆(8%)，手段(5%)，使用杠杆(2%)，撬开(1%)


→来自拉丁语levare,升起，举起，来自legwh,轻的，可举起的，词源同light,levitate.引申词义杠杆。
杠杆(lev+er→举起［重东西］的东西→杠杆)[lev,live=raise,lighten,表示"提高,举起,变轻"]
n.杆,杠杆,手段,途径,工具However, Lever never fevers; nevertheless, he is clever forever.无论如何,杠杆从未发烧;尽管如此,他始终机灵.



US ['lev.ɚ] noun countable BAR/HANDLE  棍棒／手柄  ■a bar or handle which moves around a fixed point, so that one end of it can be pushed or pulled in order to control the operation of a machine or move a heavy or stiff object 杠杆，操纵杆，控制手柄
UK ['li:.vər] US ['lev.ɚ] noun countable ADVANTAGE  优势  ■something you use, often unfairly, to try to persuade someone to do what you want （用以说服别人的）手段，把柄



n. [机] 杠杆；控制杆
 - Control arm, heaver
examples: 英 ['liːvə(r)] 美 ['levər]
n.杠杆；控制杆；手段v.撬开；使用杠杆

(1) He employed his knife as a lever.(2) This lever must serve some ulterior purpose.(3) Push hard and the lever will go down.(4) This latest incident may be the lever needed to change government policy.(5) They managed to lever the door open.(6) We are trying to lever the roots out, but in vain.(7) The worker is levering at the rock.
(1) 他把刀子当杠杆用。(2) 这撬棒准是用于不可告人的目的的。(3) 用力推就能把控制杆按下去。(4) 最近的事件或许可以作为迫使政府改变政策所需的手段。(5) 他们设法撬开了门。(6) 我们试图撬掉这些树根,但没有成功。(7) 工人用杠杆移动岩石。

translation:
adj. 有责任的; 有义务的; 有…倾向的; 易…的

分布：有义务的(59%)，可能的(21%)，有 ... 倾向(10%)，应负责的(10%)


→来自拉丁语ligare,绑定，连结，词源同ligament,oblige.
a.有...倾向的;可能遭受...的;有责任的I'm liable to give reliable reply to the application for supply of apples.我有责任对申请供应苹果给予可靠答复.



adjective [after verb] RESPONSIBLE  负责的  specialized■having (legal) responsibility for something or someone 承担责任的；负有（法律）责任的
•The law holds parents liable if a child does not attend school.这项法律规定孩子不上学父母要负法律责任。

•If we lose the case we may be liable for (= have to pay) the costs of the whole trial.如果我们输掉了这场官司，就要承担官司的全部费用。

['laɪ.ə.bl] adjective [after verb] LIKELY  可能的  ■very likely to happen 很可能会发生的，可能性很大的
•The areas of town near the river are liable to flooding (= are often flooded).这个城镇靠近河边的地区很容易遭到水淹。

•[+ to infinitive] He's liable to make a fuss if you wake him.你如果把他吵醒了，他会大发雷霆的。





apt, subject, liable, likely, prone

这组词都有“倾向于……的；易于……的”的意思，其区别是：
apt: 口语中常用，指自然的或习惯的倾向，无特殊的褒贬意味，常指在一般情况下发生的事。
subject: 指确实可以察觉的倾向，也就是总结出来的规律。
liable: 指易于产生某种不利的结果，侧重偶然性，常表示警告或提醒。
likely: 侧重可能性，用于指将来，预言希望或所不希望的结果。
prone: 多用于人，着重其本性，或倾向于某种错误、弱点或不良行为等。



responsible, liable

这组词都有“对某人或某事负责的”的意思，其区别是：
responsible: 指能熟练而出色地履行职责或完成任务，或指在出差错而对其原因有争执时承担过失。
liable: 着重指在不履行债务等时应负法律责任或受罚。


adj. 有责任的，有义务的；应受罚的；有…倾向的；易…的
 - responsible, bound, accountable, prone
examples: 英 ['laɪəbl] 美 ['laɪəbl]
adj.有义务的；应负责的；有 ... 倾向；可能的；易遭受…的，易患…（病）的

(1) He declared that he was not liable for his wife's debts.(2) They are liable to run off with your money.(3) We are liable to make mistakes.(4) A feeble attempt is liable to fail.(5) Failure to pay your taxes will make you liable to prosecution.
(1) 他宣称对妻子的债务不负责。(2) 他们有卷款而走的倾向。(3) 我们都易犯错误。(4) 愚蠢的尝试多半是要失败的。(5) 不缴纳税款就可能被起诉。
[sound:youdao-dc715e67-dea36cf6-5b015cf1-fc84400c-a4efe6ec.mp3]

translation:
n. 说谎者

分布：骗子(53%)，说谎者(47%)


→来自lie,撒谎，-ar,人。
说谎者(lie说谎)[-ar 1.表形容词"…的"2.表名词"人,物"]
【记】源于：lie（v 躺；v 说谎）



US [-ɚ] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■someone who tells lies 骗子，说谎者
•He's such a liar - you can't trust a word he says.他是个大骗子——他说的话一句都不能信。

•[as form of address] You liar - I never touched it!你这个谎话连篇的家伙——我从未动过它！
examples: 英 ['laɪə(r)] 美 ['laɪər]
n.说谎者；骗子

(1) You scabby liar!(2) He was a liar.(3) Are you insinuating that I am a liar?(4) Hope is the only universal liar who never loses his reputation for veracity.(5) Are you simple enough to believe what that liar tells you?(6) It's my considered opinion that he is a liar and a cheat.
(1) 你这个卑鄙的撒谎的人！(2) 他是一个说谎者。(3) 你绕来绕去是否暗指我在撒谎？(4) 希望，是唯一决不会失去真实姓名声的全球性说谎者。(5) 你会蠢到相信那骗子说的话吗?(6) 我经过仔细考虑，认为他是个说谎的家伙，又是个骗子。

translation:
n. 自由主义者; 自由党党员
adj. 开明的; 自由的; 慷慨的; 不拘泥的

分布：自由主义者(36%)，自由主义的(27%)，开明的(18%)，慷慨的(11%)，大方的(5%)，开明的人(3%)


→来自leu-dhero,来自*leu,人民，自由人，词源同eleutherian,自由人的，-dhero,工具格后缀，引申词义自由的，开明的，大方的，无私的，高贵的。现主要用于自由的，词义演变比较frank.
自由的;慷慨的(liber+al)[liber=free,表示"自由"]
a.慷慨的,大方的;富足的;自由的,思想开放的The church has become more liberal in this century.本世纪教会变得不那么守旧了.



US [-ɚ-] adjective SOCIETY  社会   ADVANCED  ■respecting and allowing many different types of beliefs or behaviour 自由开放的，开放的，开明的
•a liberal society/attitude自由开放的社会／态度

•Her parents were far more liberal than mine.她父母比我父母开明得多。
 Opposite illiberal or intolerant
UK ['lɪb.ər.əl/ UK [-rəl] US [-ɚ-] adjective POLITICS  政治   ADVANCED  ■(of a political party or a country) believing in or allowing more personal freedom and a development towards a fairer sharing of wealth and power within society （指政党或国家）自由的，开放的
UK ['lɪb.ər.əl/ UK [-rəl] US [-ɚ-] adjective GENEROUS  慷慨的  formal ■giving or given in a generous way 慷慨的，大方的，毫不吝啬的
•He was very liberal with the wine.对于酒他毫不吝啬。

UK ['lɪb.ər.əl/ UK [-rəl] US [-ɚ-] adjective NOT EXACT  不确切的  ■not exact; without attention to or interest in detail 不确切的，模糊的，笼统的
•a liberal interpretation of the law对法律的笼统解释

UK ['lɪb.ər.əl/ UK [-rəl] US [-ɚ-] noun countable UK [ˈlɪb.ər.əl]    UK [-rəl] US [-ə˞-/■someone who respects many different types of beliefs or behaviour 自由主义者
•He's a good old-fashioned liberal.他是个老式的自由主义者。




adj. 自由主义的；慷慨的；不拘泥的；宽大的
 - generous, handsome
n. 自由主义者
 - latitudinarian
examples: 英 ['lɪbərəl] 美 ['lɪbərəl]
adj.慷慨的；大方的；开明的；自由主义的n.自由主义者；开明的人

(1) She is liberal with her money.(2) Her parents are very liberal and allow her a lot of freedom.(3) The headmaster has liberal views about what his pupils should wear.(4) His rise to power indicated the end of the liberal era.(5) He is an open-minded liberal.(6) He liked to think of himself as a liberal.
(1) 她用钱大方。(2) 她的父母很开明，让她享有许多的自由。(3) 校长对他的学生应穿什么服装这一点持开明的态度。(4) 他的掌权预示著自由主义时代的结束。(5) 他是一个开明的自由主义者。(6) 他喜欢把自己视为开明的人。

translation:
vt. 解放; 释放; 释出，放出

时态：liberated, liberating, liberates
分布：解放(76%)，放出(20%)，释出(3%)，使获得自由(1%)


→来自liberal,自由的，-ate,动词后缀。
解放,释放(liber+ate→使...自由→解放)[liber=free,表示"自由"]
vt.解放,释放I deliberately liberated the man who was in despair and desperately struggled for liberation and liberty.我有意解放了那个拼命地争取解放和自由的绝望者.
【记】liber自由，使人自由－释放【反】incarcerate（v 把…关进监狱）；fetter（v 束缚；加脚镣）management（n 管理）unfettered liberty（没有约束的自由）



US [-ɚ.eɪt] verb transitive ■to help someone or something to be free 解放，使自由
•They said they sent troops in to liberate the people/the country from a dictator.他们称他们向该国派出军队是要把那里的人民／那个国家从独裁者手中解放出来。
■humorous ■to steal something 偷窃，偷盗
•She liberated those spoons from a restaurant last week.上周她从一家餐厅偷了那些汤匙。





free, liberate, discharge, release

这组词都有“解放，释放”的意思，其区别是：
free: 指不再受任何限制、约束、阻碍和压迫，完全可按自己的意志行事。
liberate: 常指从束缚和压迫中解放出来，强调获得最终的解放，有时可和free换用。
discharge: 强调把某人或某物从监禁、束缚中释放出来。
release: 侧重指放松限制、解除监禁或免除义务。


vt. 解放；放出；释放
 - deliver, issue, emancipate
examples: 英 ['lɪbəreɪt] 美 ['lɪbəreɪt]
v.解放；使获得自由；释出；放出

(1) The country was liberated in 1966.(2) Our army had liberated many occupied areas.(3) They can liberate us from the limitations of our thoughts and feelings.(4) This will liberate him from economic worry.(5) There are some methylmercuric compounds which do not liberate methylmercury for extraction by the action of strong halide acids alone.(6) The free alkali metals react immediately with water to liberate hydrogen.
(1) 这个国家是在1966年解放的。(2) 我们的军队解放了许多地区。(3) 他们可以使我们从思想与感受解放。(4) 这将解除他经济上的忧虑。(5) 有一些甲基汞化合物，它们在强含卤酸的单独作用下不能释出供萃取的甲基汞。(6) 游离的碱金属直接和水中作用，放出氢气。
[sound:youdao-1fad8bca-032fadd7-7732ccb3-a051df54-74b00b30.mp3]

translation:
n. 解放; 释放，逸出

分布：解放(100%)


解放;释放(liberate+ion)[liber=free,表示"自由"]



noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■when something or someone is released or made free 解放；解脱
•the liberation of France from Nazi occupation解放被纳粹占领的法国

•Leaving school was such a liberation for me.离开学校对我来说真是一种解脱。
 ADVANCED  ■used to refer to activities connected with removing the disadvantages experienced by particular groups within society 解放
•the women's liberation (informallib)movement妇女解放运动

•animal liberation organizations动物解救组织




n. 释放，解放
 - release, emancipation
examples: 英 [ˌlɪbə'reɪʃn] 美 [ˌlɪbə'reɪʃn]
n.解放；解放运动（为获得平等权利和地位的行为）

(1) We came off relief grain shortly after liberation.(2) Only after liberation is he able to go to school.(3) The national liberation movement was gathering.(4) Third part, Climax of the women's liberation movement in Shanghai.
(1) 解放后不久，我们就不吃救济粮了。(2) 只是在解放后，他才能去上学。(3) 民族解放运动正日益高涨。(4) 第三部分，上海妇女解放运动的高潮。
[sound:youdao-feeee510-cf973c46-2657dcfb-2f17e66e-7b324f96.mp3]

translation:
n. 自由; 许可权; 放肆，无礼; 解放，释放

分布：自由(96%)，自由权(3%)，冒失(1%)


→词源同liberal,自由的，-ty,名词后缀。引申词义自由过度，放肆，无礼。
自由(liber+ty)[liber=free,表示"自由"]
n.自由,自由权;特权I deliberately liberated the man who was in despair and desperately struggled for liberation and liberty.我有意解放了那个拼命地争取解放和自由的绝望者.



US [-ɚ.tˌi] noun FREEDOM  自由   IMPROVER  uncountable formal ■the freedom to live as you wish or go where you want 自由
•For most citizens, liberty means the freedom to practise their religious or political beliefs.对大多数公民而言，自由意味着可以不受限制地信奉自己的宗教或政治信仰。

•Hundreds of political prisoners are to be given their liberty (= released from prison).数百名政治犯将获得自由。

•Of the ten men who escaped this morning from Dartmoor Prison, only two are still at liberty (= free or not yet caught).今晨从达特摩尔监狱逃跑的十人当中，目前只有两人依然在逃。
be at liberty to do sth formal ■to be allowed to do something 被准许做…
•I'm not at liberty to reveal any names.我无权透露任何人的名字。
liberties [plural] formal ■freedom to live as you wish or go where you want 自由
•These laws will restrict our ancient rights and liberties.这些法律将限制我们固有的权利和自由。

UK ['lɪb.ə.ti] US [-ɚ.tˌi] noun BAD BEHAVIOUR  不良行为  countable ■an example of speech or behaviour that upsets other people because it shows little respect or does not follow what is thought to be polite or acceptable 放肆，无礼，失礼
•What a liberty, to refuse the invitation on your behalf, without even asking you!太放肆了，连问你都不问就以你的名义一口回绝了邀请！
take liberties (with sth) ■to change something, especially a piece of writing, in a way that people disagree with 任意歪曲，随意改动take liberties (with sb) old-fashioned ■to be too friendly with someone, usually in a sexual way （对某人）过分亲昵，过分亲热；调戏
•Some of the younger women complained that he'd been taking liberties with them.一些年轻一点的妇女抱怨说他对她们过分亲热。

UK ['lɪb.ə.ti] US [-ɚ.tˌi] noun take the liberty of doing sth formal ■to do something that will have an effect on someone else, without asking their permission 擅自做…，自行作主做…
•I took the liberty of booking theatre seats for us.我自作主张给大家预订了戏票。





liberty, freedom

这组词都有“自由”的意思，其区别是：
liberty: 常可与freedom换用，但强调从过去受的压制、管束下被解救或释放出来，也指法律所承认的特权，如言论、集会等自由。
freedom: 含义广，指任何无限制无束缚的自由自在状态。


n. 自由；许可；冒失
 - freedom, permission, leave
examples: 英 ['lɪbəti] 美 ['lɪbərti]
n.自由；自由权；冒失

(1) Those prisoners are dreaming of liberty.(2) Everybody is at liberty to air his views.(3) Women used to have little liberty.(4) I am afraid that I am not at liberty to discuss this matter.(5) Liberties are enjoyed by all citizens.(6) I took the liberty of borrowing your lawn-mower while you were away.(7) I took the liberty of reading the letter, even though it was addressed to you.
(1) 这些囚犯们梦想着获得自由。(2) 每个人都有发表意见的自由。(3) 过去妇女没有多少自由。(4) 对不起，我无权讨论这个问题。(5) 公民皆享有自由权。(6) 你不在的时候我擅自借用了你的刈草机。(7) 尽管这封信是写给你的，但是我冒昧地看过了。

•a record library唱片出借处

■a collection or set of books, records or other things, all produced in the same style or about the same subject 文库；丛书；唱片集

translation:
n. 许可证，执照; 特许

特许,许可证[licen=allow,表示"允许"]
批准,许可[licen=allow,表示"允许"]
n.(licence)许可证,执照v.准许,认可The junior and senior of the senate all have driver's licenses.参议院的年长者和年少者都有驾驶执照.
【记】一个人的特许太多就会有行为的自由。



verb transitive ■to give someone official permission to do or have something 许可，授权，特许
•[+ to infinitive] Several companies have been licensed to sell these products.一些公司获得了这些产品的销售许可。





certificate, license

(1) His license was suspended for six months.(2) The designers were allowed a lot of creative license.(3) Are you licensed to drive?(4) The shop was licensed to sell tobacco.

translation:
vt. 舔; <口>打败
vt. & vi. 轻轻拍打; 战胜
n. 舔; 一舐的量，少量

时态：licked, licking, licks
分布：舔(74%)，打(17%)，少许(3%)，轻拍(3%)，掠过(2%)，击败(1%)


→来自leigh,舔，拟声词，词源同lecher,lichen.
vt.舔;(火焰或浪)掠过;打败n.舔;少量His wicked trick is to get the kids to kick bricks and lick the cricket ticket.他的缺德恶作剧是让孩子们踢砖和舔板球门票.



verb MOVE TONGUE  移动舌头   ADVANCED  transitive ■to move the tongue across the surface of something 舔，舐
•He licked the chocolate off his fingers.他把手指上的巧克力舔干净了。

•She licked the stamps and stuck them on the parcel.她舔了一下邮票，然后贴在包裹上。
 ADVANCED  transitive intransitive + prep ■If flames or waves lick something, they pass over it quickly or touch it lightly like a tongue （火焰）蔓延，掠过，吞卷；（波浪）拍击，冲刷
•Within a few seconds flames were licking at the curtains.几秒钟之内火舌就蔓延到了窗帘。

[lɪk] verb DEFEAT  打败  transitive informal ■to defeat easily in a competition, fight, etc （在竞赛、争斗等中）轻易打败，轻取
•We'll lick the other teams.我们将一举击败其他球队。

[lɪk] verb have (got) sth licked informal ■to have solved a problem 已轻松解决…
[lɪk] verb lick sb's boots (offensive lick sb's arse/ass) informal ■to try very hard to please someone in authority, usually in order to get an advantage 对（某人）阿谀奉承，对（某人）拍马屁
•He needn't expect me to go licking his boots!他不用指望我去拍他的马屁！

[lɪk] verb lick your lips ■to move your tongue along your lips 舔嘴唇
•She took a bite of doughnut and licked her lips.她咬了一口甜甜圈，然后舔了舔嘴唇。
■to feel pleasure at the thought of something 垂涎欲滴地期待
•He licked his lips at the thought of all that money.一想到那么多的钱，他就有些迫不及待了。

[lɪk] verb lick your wounds ■to spend time getting back your strength or happiness after a defeat or bad experience 养伤，休整；重整旗鼓
[lɪk] noun HIT  打击  countable old-fashioned informal ■when you hit someone with something such as a whip 抽打，鞭打
[lɪk] noun SPEED  速度  at a hell of lick UK informal ■at a fast speed 快速，飞速
•The trains go by at a hell of a lick.火车疾驰而过。

[lɪk] noun SMALL AMOUNT  少量  countable informal ■a small amount or thin layer 少量；薄层
•The living room could do with a lick of paint.客厅薄薄地刷一层油漆就行了。

[lɪk] noun MUSIC  音乐  countable specialized ■in jazz or rock music, a short series of notes played by one musician （爵士乐或摇滚乐中的）小过门
[lɪk] noun TONGUE  舌头  countable ■the action of licking something 舔，舐
•Can I have a lick of your ice cream?我可以尝一口你的霜淇淋吗？

[lɪk] noun a lick and a promise old-fashioned informal ■a quick and careless cleaning or wash 匆匆打扫，草草洗涮



vt. 舔；卷过；鞭打
 - tongue, hide
n. 舔；打；少许
 - hit, little, touch, beating
examples: 英 [lɪk] 美 [lɪk]
v.舔；轻拍；击败；掠过n.舔；少许；打；速度

(1) He licked his fingers.(2) The kitty licked up the milk.(3) It was easy for our team to lick theirs.(4) The flames licked up everything.(5) He gave the bowl a thorough lick.(6) The boat would look better with a lick of paint.(7) I cannot lick a fault out of him.(8) The camp was delirious with hope, we had licked the Germans, and we were going to lick the Japanese.
(1) 他舔手指。(2) 小猫舔光了牛奶。(3) 我们队很容易打败他们队。(4) 火焰将一切烧尽。(5) 他把饭碗舔得一干二净。(6) 这小船稍加颜色就好看了。(7) 我无论怎样打都改不了他的缺点。(8) 全营的人在日日狂喜中怀着希望，德国被我们打垮了，日本还能持久吗？

translation:
n. 盖子; 限制; [口]果盖; [口]遮盖
vt. 给…盖盖子

分布：盖子(86%)，眼睑(13%)，给 ... 装盖子(1%)


→来自古英语hlid,盖子，覆盖，开口，来自klei,倾斜，词源同lean.
n.盖The man who broke the sole solid lid is solemnly condemned.打破这个仅有的实心盖子的人受到庄严谴责.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a cover on a container, which can be lifted up or removed 盖，盖子
•Can you get the lid off this jar?你能把罐子的盖打开吗？

•Put a lid on the saucepan.给平底深锅盖上盖子。
■an eyelid  (= either of the two pieces of skin which can close over each eye) 眼睑，眼皮
•She looked at him from under half-closed lids.她眯着眼睛看着他。

[lɪd] noun countable blow/take the lid off sth (also lift the lid on sth) informal ■to cause something bad that was previously kept secret to be known by the public 揭露…的真相
•In 1989 they started an investigation that was to blow the lid off corruption in the police force.1989年他们开始调查，意图揭露员警队伍中的腐败现象。

[lɪd] noun countable keep the lid on sth informal ■to control the level of something in order to stop it increasing 防止…失控；限制，压制
•The government have intervened to keep a lid on inflation.政府已对通货膨胀进行了干预限制。

[lɪd] noun countable put the lid on sth UK old-fashioned ■If something that happens puts the lid on a plan, it causes the plan to fail 使…失败，使（计划）落空
•Well, James' resignation just about puts the lid on it /the project.詹姆斯的辞职几乎使它／该专案流产。





lid, cover

这组词都有“盖子，遮盖物”的意思，其区别是：
lid: 通常指可以揭开的如箱盖、坛盖、壶盖等盖子。
cover: 泛指所有的遮盖物。包括盖子或书籍、杂志的封面等。


n. 盖子；眼睑；限制
 - limitation, qualification, restriction, cover
examples: 英 [lɪd] 美 [lɪd]
n.盖子；眼睑vt.给 ... 装盖子

(1) He slammed the lid down.(2) She gave the lid a few gentle taps to loosen it.(3) The lid of this jam pot won't unscrew.(4) She lifted the lid of the pot to add some salt.(5) He had not lost the eye, but the upper lid was neatly sliced.(6) They forgot to lid the garbage can.
(1) 他砰的一声盖上了盖子。(2) 她把盖子轻拍了几下使它松动。(3) 这果酱罐的盖子拧不开。(4) 她掀起锅盖加点盐。(5) 他保住了眼睛，但上眼睑几乎被切掉了。(6) 他们忘了盖垃圾桶了。
[sound:youdao-97112ecc-cc35fb0d-194bbf51-03b13980-8427a48e.mp3]

translation:
v. 躺; 坐落在; 处于…状态; 说谎
n. 谎言; 谎话; 状态; 位置

时态：lay, lain, lying, lies
分布：谎言(47%)，说谎(25%)，躺下(11%)，在于(8%)，位于(5%)，存在(3%)，平放(1%)


→来自legh,躺，卧，词源同lair,litter.进一步来自skel,弯，转，词源同scoliosis,isosceles.lie 撒谎
vi.躺,平放;处于;位于v.说谎n.谎话He told me a lie.他对我说了个谎.



verb POSITION  姿态   ESSENTIAL  intransitive + adverb or preposition [L] (lying, lay, lain)■to be in or move into a horizontal position on a surface 躺；平躺；平卧
•to lie in bed躺在床上

•to lie on a beach躺在海滩上

•to lie on your side侧卧

•A cat lay in front of the fire.一只猫趴在炉火前。

•He lies awake at night, worrying.晚上他躺在床上焦虑不安，无法入睡。

•A pen lay on the desk.桌子上放着一枝铅笔。
 ESSENTIAL  intransitive + adverb or preposition [L] (lying, lay, lain)■If something lies in a particular place, position or direction, it is in that place, position or direction 位于，处在，坐落在
•There's an old pair of shoes of yours lying at/in the bottom of the wardrobe.衣柜最下面放着一双你的旧鞋子。

•The river lies 30km to the south.那条河在南面30公里处。

•Cambridge United are lying third in the league.剑桥联队在联赛中位居第三。

•Here lies the body of Mary Taylor (= This is where Mary Taylor is buried).玛丽‧泰勒葬于此处。

•There are several houses lying empty in the town.城里有几座空房子。

•The town lay in ruins.城镇已成为一片废墟。

•The ship lies off (= is positioned near) the coast of Spain.那艘船位于西班牙海岸附近。
 ADVANCED  intransitive + adverb or preposition (lying, lay, lain)■to exist 存在，在
•The hardest part of the competition still lies ahead of us.比赛最艰难的阶段还在前面呢。
 ADVANCED  intransitive usually + adverb or preposition (lying, lay, lain)■If responsibility, blame, a decision, a choice, etc. lies with someone, they have responsibility, must make the decision, etc. （责任、罪责、决定、选择等）在于
•Responsibility for the disaster must ultimately lie with the government.发生此次灾难的责任最终必须由政府来承担。

•Where does the blame lie?谁来承担罪责？
lie in state (lying, lay, lain)■When the dead body of an important person lies in state, it is arranged so that the public can see and honour it before it is buried. （重要人物的遗体埋葬前经整容后）供公众瞻仰
[laɪ] verb SPEAK FALSELY  说谎   ESSENTIAL  intransitive (lying, lied, lied)■to say or write something which is not true in order to deceive someone 说谎，撒谎，扯谎
•Are you lying to me?你是不是在跟我撒谎？

•Don't trust her - she's lying.别信她的——她在说谎。

•I suspect he lies about his age.我怀疑他虚报了年龄。
⇒ See also liar
[laɪ] verb lie doggo UK old-fashioned informal ■to keep still and hide so that you cannot be found 隐蔽地埋伏着
[laɪ] verb lie down on the job mainly US disapproving ■to fail to work as hard or as well as you should 偷懒，应付，凑合
[laɪ] verb lie low informal ■to try not to be noticed 低调行事，不张扬
•I'd lie low if I were you till the trouble passes.我要是你就别张扬，等麻烦过去后再说。

[laɪ] verb lie through your teeth informal ■to tell someone something which you know is completely false 说谎话；睁眼说瞎话
•He asked me how old I was and, lying through my teeth, I said '29'.他问我多大了，我骗他说是29岁。

[laɪ] verb not take sth lying down ■to refuse to be treated badly by someone 不逆来顺受，不受气
•He can't treat you like that! Surely you're not going to take that lying down!他不能那样对待你！你当然不能受这个气！

[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie about/around ■If things are lying about/around, they are left in places where they should not be 乱放，乱搁
•Has anyone seen my keys lying about?有人看见我的锁匙留在甚么地方了吗？

•I wouldn't leave any money lying around the office if I were you.我要是你就不会把钱在办公室里乱放。

[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie around ■to spend time lying down and doing very little 无所事事，懒散度日
•I spent a week in Spain, lying around on the beach.我在西班牙逗留了一周，在海滩上享受清闲。

[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie back ■to move the top half of your body from a sitting to a lying position 向后躺，向后仰
•She lay back in the dentist's chair and tried to relax.她向后躺在牙医的椅子上，尽量让自己放松下来。

[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie behind sth ■If something lies behind something else, it is the hidden cause of it 是隐藏在…背后的原因，是…的真实原因
•Do you know what lies behind their decision?你知道他们的决定背后的真实原因吗？

[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie down  ESSENTIAL  ■to move into a position in which your body is flat, usually in order to sleep or rest 躺下
•He lay down on the bed and tried to relax.他躺在床上想休息一下。
 lie-down /ˌlaɪˈdaʊn] noun only singular mainly UK informal ■a short rest, usually in bed 小憩，躺一会儿，休息一下
•I usually have a bit of a lie down after lunch.午饭后我通常都要休息一下。

•She said she was going for a lie down.她说她要去休息一会儿。

[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie in UK ■to stay in bed later than usual in the morning 睡懒觉
•It was a Sunday, so she could lie in till almost lunch time.那是个星期天，所以她可以睡懒觉一直睡到快要吃午饭的时候。
 lie-in /ˌlaɪˈɪn] noun countable usually singular UK 2. I'm not working tomorrow so I can have a bit of a lie-in. 明天我不上班，所以可以睡一会儿懒觉了。
[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie in sth UK ■to exist or be found in something 存在于；在于
•His skill lies in his ability to communicate quite complex ideas very simply.他的高明之处在于他能将复杂的思想用非常简单的方式表达出来。

•The play's interest lies in the questions it raises about sexuality.这出戏有趣的地方在于它提出了性的问题。

[laɪ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lie up mainly UK ■to hide from police officers, soldiers, etc. who are looking for you 躲避（员警或士兵等的搜索）
•The escaped prisoners lay up in a barn for a few weeks, until the search had been called off.逃犯在一个谷仓里躲藏了数周，直到对他们的搜索取消为止。

[laɪ] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■something that you say which you know is not true 谎话，瞎话
•I told a lie when I said I liked her haircut.我骗她说我喜欢她的发型。

[laɪ] noun countable be a pack of lies (formal be a tissue of lies) ■to be completely untrue 谎话连篇，一派胡言
•The whole report is a pack of lies.整个报告谎话连篇。

[laɪ] noun countable give the lie to sth ■to prove that something is not true 证明…不实
•The fact that the number of deaths from cancer in the area has doubled surely gives the lie to official assurances of the safety of nuclear power.该地区的癌症死亡人数已经增了一倍，这个事实说明官方对核电安全性所作的种种保证纯属一派胡言。

[laɪ] noun countable I tell a lie mainly UK ■something you say when you have just said something wrong and want to correct it （用于纠正刚刚说过的话）我说错了
•Her name is Paula, no, I tell a lie (= I'm wrong) - it's Pauline.她的名字叫宝拉，哦，不对——叫保利娜。

[laɪ] noun countable the lie of the land UK (US the lay of the land) ■the shape or height of the land 地形；地势




lied, lay, lie

lied: lied lying    撒谎
lay: vt laid laid laying   放
lie: vi lay lain lying    躺



situate, stand, lie

这组词都有“位于”的意思，其区别是：
situate: 通常用过去分词作表语，指某城镇、乡村或某物等的地理位置与环境的关系，即在何处。
stand: 多指建筑物等被想象为主体的物体立于某处。
lie: 最常用词，不及物，指国家、城镇、道路、湖海等所处的位置。


vi. 躺；说谎；位于；展现
 - sit, tell a story
n. 谎言；位置
 - location, situation, site, fiction, leasing
examples: 英 [laɪ] 美 [laɪ]
v.躺下；位于；在于；平放；存在；延伸；说谎n.谎言

(1) If you feel unwell, go and lie down.(2) My home town lies low in a hidden valley.(3) The fundamental way out lies in reform and openness.(4) The novel is lying on the table.(5) The truth lies between two extremes.(6) Our land lies between these trees and the river.(7) I promise never to lie to you from now on.(8) He degraded himself by cheating and telling lies.
(1) 如果你感到不舒服，就去躺下。(2) 我的家乡位于一个隐蔽的山谷里。(3) 根本出路在于改革开放。(4) 小说平放在桌子上。(5) 真理存在两个极端之间。(6) 我们的土地位于这些树和那条河之间(7) 我发誓从今以后再也不向你说谎话。(8) 他因欺骗、撒谎而损害了自己的人格。
[sound:youdao-4afe52d2-bb7ecba7-581f1071-2d836eea-06ed75f3.mp3]

translation:
n. 陆军中尉; 副职官员; 海军上尉; 助理人员

分布：中尉(84%)，副官(11%)，助理人员(5%)


→来自古法语lieu tenant,替代，副职，lieu,地方，tenant,占用，引申词义代替，副职官员，陆军中尉等。



US [lu:-] noun countable ■(the title of) an officer of middle rank in the armed forces 中尉
•first/second lieutenant（美国）中尉／少尉




n. 中尉；副官；助理人员
 - Lieutenant Junior Class, looie
examples: 英 [lef'tenənt] 美 [luː'tenənt]
n.中尉；助理人员；副官

(1) A young lieutenant was named for duty.(2) The ventilation is poor, the lieutenant admits.(3) The lieutenant saluted and marched quickly down the corridor.(4) He prevailed on the lieutenant to send in a short note.
(1) 一名年轻的中尉被任命担任这项职务。(2) 中尉承认，通风设备很糟糕。(3) 副官敬了个礼，然后快速的走下回廊，报信去了。(4) 他说动那个副官，递上了一张简短的便条进去。
[sound:youdao-47b1fe1a-24612eb4-e521d219-6f3256cb-870a5f0a.mp3]

translation:
n. 一生，寿命; 有生之年; 存在期，有效期
na. 终生; 终身保障; [核]寿命

分布：一生(63%)，终身(20%)，寿命(16%)，使用期限(1%)


n.一生,终生Did you know her in her lifetime?你在她的生前认识她吗?



noun countable usually singular  ADVANCED  ■the period of time during which someone lives or something exists 有生之年，终生，一辈子
•We'll see a tremendous lot of technological changes during/in our lifetime.我们在有生之年会看到无数的技术变革。

•Winners of the competition will receive the holiday of a lifetime (= the best holiday they will ever have).比赛获胜者将获得千载难逢的假期奖励。

•I've only been working here two days, but it seems like a lifetime.我才在这里工作了两天，却觉得好像已经做了一辈子似的。

•A watch of this quality should last a lifetime.品质如此之好的手表可以陪伴终生。

•Enter our competition and this once-in-a -lifetime experience could be yours!来参加我们的比赛吧，这将是你终生难得的经历！

•Marriage is no longer always seen as a lifetime commitment.婚姻已不再被看作是终生的承诺。

•You could win a lifetime's supply of toothpaste.你可能会赢得终身免费使用牙膏的奖品。




n. 一生；寿命；终生；使用期
 - whole life, all one's life
examples: 英 ['laɪftaɪm] 美 ['laɪftaɪm]
n.一生；终身；寿命；使用期限

(1) He met with many a setback in his lifetime.(2) The century plant blooms only once in its lifetime.(3) Learning is the enterprise of a lifetime.(4) These experiences can help make saving money a lifetime habit.(5) Their lifetime is stretched by their motion.(6) Eighty years constitute a longer-than-average lifetime.
(1) 他一生中遭到过许多挫折。(2) 龙舌兰在其一生中只开一次花。(3) 学习是终身的事业。(4) 这些经历能使存钱成为终身的习惯。(5) 由于它们的运动其寿命延长了。(6) 八十岁高于平均寿命。
[sound:youdao-ac716664-ccdd8ef8-6eec9e2d-c181a1f3-0e6d15af.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 举起，抬起
vt. 举起; 提升; 鼓舞; 抬起
vi. 消散; 升起; 耸立
n. 电梯; 举起; 起重机; 搭车

时态：lifted, lifting, lifts
分布：举起(46%)，提升(17%)，电梯(10%)，帮助(8%)，取消(5%)，偷窃(4%)，搭便车(3%)，运送(3%)，升高(2%)，扒窃(1%)，载货量(1%)


→来自Proto-Germanic*luftuz,空气，天空，词源同loft.可能进一步来自legwh,轻的，举起，词源同lever,light.
v.升起,举起,消散n.电梯,上升,免费搭车The drifter swiftly shifted the gift to the left of the lift.那个漂泊者敏捷地将礼物换到电梯的左边.



verb RAISE  举起   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to move something from a lower to a higher position 举起，提起，抬起，吊起
•Could you help me lift this table, please?你能帮我抬一下桌子吗？

•Could you lift your chair a bit - I've got my bag caught under it.你能把椅子稍微抬一下吗——我的袋子被压住了。

•She lifted the cigarette (up) to her lips.她把香烟举到唇边。

•He lifted his eyes (= looked up) from the paper and glared.他的目光从报纸上移开，抬起头来怒目而视。
transitive specialized ■to dig underground vegetables or plants out of the ground 把（蔬菜或植物）挖出来，刨出，拔出
•They're lifting potatoes.他们正在挖马铃薯。

[lɪft] verb TAKE HOLD  抓住   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive [usually + adv/prep] ■to take hold of and raise in order to remove, carry or move to a different position 提起；抱起；移开
•She lifted the baby out of her chair.她把婴儿从椅子上抱起来。

•He lifted the box carefully down from the shelf.他小心地从架子上取下那个盒子。

[lɪft] verb MAKE LOUD  使大声  transitive literary ■to make your voice louder, especially when performing （尤指在演出时）提高（声调）
[lɪft] verb MAKE INTERESTING  使有趣  transitive informal ■to make something more interesting or enjoyable 使更有趣；增加…的趣味性
•The article is informative enough, but it's a bit dull - we need something to lift it.这篇文章够资讯性，但有些枯燥——我们需要增强它的趣味性。

[lɪft] verb MAKE HAPPY  使高兴  lift sb's spirits informal ■to make someone happier 提高（某人）的兴致
•Nothing - not even the prospect of dinner - could lift his spirits.甚么都提不起他的兴致，甚至连吃饭也不例外。

[lɪft] verb GO AWAY  离开  intransitive ■(of mist or fog) to go away until none is left （雾气）散去，散开，消散
•The morning mist had lifted and the sun was starting to come through.晨雾已经散去，太阳开始放出光芒。

[lɪft] verb END  终止  transitive ■to end a rule or law 取消，撤销（规定或法律）
•The restrictions on water usage have been lifted now that the river levels are normal.河水的水位已经恢复正常，因此用水限制被取消了。

•At last they've lifted the ban on jeans at the club.最终他们取消了在俱乐部禁止穿牛仔裤的规定。

[lɪft] verb STEAL  偷  transitive informal ■to steal something 偷窃，偷盗transitive informal ■to use someone else's writing, music or idea, pretending that it is your own 剽窃
•He'd lifted whole passages from a journal.他从一本杂志上整段整段地剽窃文章。

[lɪft] noun CARRYING DEVICE  载重装置   ESSENTIAL  countable UK (US elevator) ■a device like a box which moves up and down, carrying people or goods from one floor of a building to another or taking people up and down underground in a mine 电梯；升降机
•Take the lift to the sixth floor.乘电梯到六楼。

[lɪft] noun RAISE  举起  countable or uncountable ■an act of lifting or raising something 举，提，抬，吊
•Give it one more lift and we'll have it at the top of the stairs.再抬一下我们就能把它抬到楼梯顶端了。
uncountable specialized ■the force on the wing of a bird or aircraft that keeps it in the air as it moves forward （鸟或飞行器的）升力，提升力
[lɪft] noun JOURNEY  旅程  countable usually singular ■a free journey in another person's vehicle, especially a car 搭便车
•I'll give you a lift to the station if you like.如果你愿意，我可以载你到车站。

•He hitched a lift (= stood by the road and made a signal asking a car to stop and take him) to Birmingham.他搭便车去了伯明罕。

[lɪft] noun MAKE HAPPY  使高兴  give sb a lift ■to make someone happier 提高（某人）的兴致
•She'd been feeling a bit low but hearing that she'd got the job gave her a lift.她一直有些情绪低落，但一听说她得到了那份工作心情便好了起来。





elevate, raise, hoist, heave, lift, boost

这组词都有“升起，举起”的意思，其区别是：
elevate: 较正式用词，指位置、高度的升高，多作比喻用，指职位、品德等的提高。
raise: 较正式用词，常可与lift换用，但强调把某物举起或抬起到应有的高度。常用比喻。
hoist: 多指用绳索、滑轮等机械把重物升起。
heave: 指需花大力气或借外力才能举起或抬起重物。
lift: 指用人力或机械力把某物升到较高的位置。
boost: 原义指从后面或下面推起或提高，现常用于指提高价格、振作精神等抽象概念。



arise, raise, rise, lift

这组词都有“上升，举起”的意思，其区别是：
arise: 书面用词，多用于诗歌或比喻中，具有特殊的修辞色彩。
raise: 及物动词，常用词，多指把某物从低处升到高处，有时作引申用。
rise: 普通用词，指具体的或抽象的事物由低向高移动。
lift: 语气比raise强，指用体力或机械的力举起或抬起某物。


vt. 举起；提升；鼓舞；空运；抄袭
 - promote, stimulate, prefer, upgrade, spirit
vi. 消散；升起；耸立
 - evanesce, flee
n. 电梯；举起；起重机；搭车
 - elevator, up with
examples: 英 [lɪft] 美 [lɪft]
vt.举起；运送；偷窃；升高；还清；取消vi.提升n.举起；提升；电梯；搭便车；帮助；载货量；扒窃

(1) He was too weak even to lift his hand.(2) The helicopter lifted the entire team to the meet.(3) She was caught lifting make-up from the supermarket.(4) The good news lifted my spirits.(5) For some income levels rise after purchase, customers must first purchase the original loan repaid, can lift the selling home mortgages.(6) They decided to lift the embargo.(7) They want to lift the rate of enjoyment too.(8) Soft angelic voices lift you into higher realms.(9) With a graceful lift of her hand, she dismissed him.(10) Winning the scholarship gave her a tremendous lift.(11) He pressed the button to call the lift.(12) It was pouring rain and he just needed a lift.(13) They wouldn't lift a finger to help us.(14) Could you help me lift this iron plate?

(1) 他虚弱得连手都抬不起来。(2) 直升飞机把全队空运到运动会现场(3) 她在超级市场偷窃化妆品时被捉住了。（《牛津高阶英汉双解词典》）(4) 这好消息使我精神大振。(5) 对于一些收入水平上升的二次购房客户，原先必须将首次购房的贷款还清后，才可以解除抵押出售旧房。(6) 他们决定解除禁运。(7) 他们还想提升快乐率。(8) 温柔的天使之音将领您提升到更高的领域。(9) 她轻盈地一抬手把他打发走了。(10) 她获得奖学金後受到极大的鼓舞。(11) 他按键招呼电梯。(12) 外面下着这么大的雨,而他只是想搭个便车而已。(13) 他们不愿采取任何行动帮助我们。(14) 你能帮助我抬起这块铁板吗？
[sound:youdao-afbbbf27-1392381f-23052ddd-295e40dd-bb4ef452.mp3]

translation:
vt. 使（某物）更明亮
vi. 点亮; 减轻

时态：lightened, lightening, lightens
分布：照亮(84%)，使变淡(8%)，闪电(8%)


→来自light,轻的。



US [-tˌən] verb MAKE BRIGHT  使光明  intransitive ■to become less dark 变浅，变淡
•The sky had lightened and there were breaks in the clouds.天空变亮了，云也渐渐散开了。
 Opposite darken
UK ['laɪ.tən] US [-tˌən] verb MAKE LESS HEAVY  减轻  lighten sb's burden/load, etc. ■to make a difficult situation or responsibility easier 减轻（某人的）负担／压力等
•Getting a new assistant will lighten (= reduce) the workload considerably.配备一名新助手会极大地减轻工作压力。

UK ['laɪ.tən] US [-tˌən] verb MAKE PALE  使变淡  transitive ■to make something lighter 使变淡，使变浅
•The sun always lightens my hair.在阳光下，我的头发颜色总是显得浅些。

UK ['laɪ.tən] US [-tˌən] verb MAKE LESS SERIOUS  减轻  intransitive or transitive ■to (cause to) become happier and less worried （使）心情好转，（使）高兴起来
•His mood lightened after the phone call.他打完电话后情绪好了起来。

•He tried to lighten the atmosphere by telling a joke.他想透过讲笑话来缓解一下气氛。

UK ['laɪ.tən] US [-tˌən] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] lighten sth up ■to make a speech or piece of writing less serious 使…轻松活泼，使…不那么严肃
•I thought I'd slip in a few jokes to lighten up the talk.我本想在讲话中加几个笑话来调剂一下气氛。

UK ['laɪ.tən] US [-tˌən] verb   Phrasal Verbs   lighten up informal ■to become more relaxed and less serious 放松，缓和
•Oh, lighten up! I was only joking!哦，别紧张！我只是在开玩笑！

•I wish she'd lighten up a bit.我希望她能放松一些。




vi. 减轻；发亮
 - lamp, to alleviate
vt. 使照亮；使轻松
 - rest
examples: 英 ['laɪtn] 美 ['laɪtn]
v.使轻松，变得轻松；发亮，变亮；照亮；减轻，变轻；闪电；使变淡

(1) Her heart lightened when she heard the news.(2) His face lightened as she apologized.(3) A solitary candle lightened the darkness of the room.(4) If you want to lighten the weight, had better eat little bread.(5) The boat began to lighten, and no fresh wave swamped us.
(1) 听到这消息，她轻松了。(2) 她向他道歉时，他喜形于色。(3) 一支孤烛使黑暗的房间亮了起来。(4) 如果你想减轻体重，最好少吃面包。(5) 船轻点了，风浪也没有再来与我们为难。

adv. 轻轻地，轻巧地; 轻松地，轻快地; 轻易地，容易地，不费力地; 轻率地

分布：轻轻地(35%)，轻率地(27%)，轻快地(16%)，轻微地(11%)，轻蔑地(11%)


adverb GENTLY  轻轻地   ADVANCED  ■gently or using very little of something 轻轻地；稍稍地；少许
•She patted him lightly on the shoulder.她轻轻地拍了拍他的肩膀。

•Dust the cake lightly with icing sugar.在蛋糕上稍微撒上一点糖霜。
■If food is lightly cooked, it is cooked for only a short time 稍微（烹调）一下；嫩（炒）地
•lightly cooked vegetables烧得很嫩的蔬菜

['laɪt.li] adverb NOT SERIOUSLY  不严肃地  ■If you say something lightly, you are not serious when you say it 轻松地，随便地；不严肃地
•"Anyway, it won't affect me because I'm leaving, " she said lightly.“不管怎么说，这对我都没甚么影响，因为我就要走了。”她很轻松地说。
not do sth lightly ■If something is not said or treated lightly, it is said or treated in a serious way, after great thought 不可草率对待，不能忽视
•Accusations like these from a top minister are not made lightly.高级部长提出这样的指控不可等闲视之。

['laɪt.li] adverb NOT SEVERELY  不严重地  get off lightly; let sb off lightly ■to be punished or punish someone less severely than might have been expected 得到从轻判罚；对（某人）从轻判罚
•I think he got off quite lightly considering it's his third driving offence.这已经是他第三次违法驾驶了，我觉得对他罚得太轻了。




adv. 轻轻地；轻松地；容易地；不费力地

examples: 英 ['laɪtli] 美 ['laɪtli]

(1) She trod lightly so as not to wake the baby.(2) He pressed lightly on the handle.(3) The girl tripped lightly down the path.(4) The child tripped lightly like a bird.(5) He never made a decision lightly.(6) He's a carefree fellow who bears his responsibilities lightly.
(1) 她步子很轻，以免惊醒孩子。(2) 他轻轻按下手柄。(3) 女孩步伐轻快地在小道上行走。(4) 那个孩子像鸟儿一样轻快地奔跑着。(5) 他从不轻率地作决定。(6) 他是个满不在意不大负责的人。

n. 闪电，雷电

→来自light,发光，照明，插入鼻音字母n,引申词义闪电。
n.闪电a.闪电般的,快速的I slightly delight in flight in the sunlight and lightning.我有点喜欢在阳光和闪电中飞行.



noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■a flash of bright light in the sky which is produced by electricity moving between clouds or from clouds to the ground 闪电
•thunder and lightning雷电

•a flash of lightning一道闪电

•That tree was struck by lightning.那棵树被闪电击中了。

•She changed her clothes with  lightning  speed (= extremely quickly).她飞快地换了衣服。

['laɪt.nɪŋ] noun uncountable Lightning never strikes twice (in the same place). saying ■said to show that it is unlikely that something bad or unusual will happen to the same person twice 闪电不会两次击中同一个地方；倒楣事不会总落在同一个人身上；一事不过二
['laɪt.nɪŋ] noun uncountable like lightning ■extremely quickly 闪电般地，极快地

(1) The little girl is afraid of thunder and lightning.(2) The tree was struck by lightning and splintered.(3) He drove the car with lightning speed.(4) He would shoot his water-pot into the tank with a lightning movement so as to get his supply from an uncontaminated depth.(5) With his unrestrained use of personal pronouns Gao creates lightning shifts of perspective and compels the reader to question all confidences.
